Reviews.Title: “Extremely impressive makeover of a dated hotel. Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Ian K
Reviews.Content: If you like red and brown rooms then this is the place to stay. Overall very comfortable, perfect location to wine, dine, theatre go and club if you so desire. Breakfast room is very pleasant for a relaxing start to the day. Business centre is not worth the trouble as its by the minute. Front desk staff are extremely helpful and you get the sense that they really care if you enjoy your stay -- they either get paid really well or they are genuinely nice people -- what a refreshing change. Stay here. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandra J
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with halpfull staff and newly renovated rooms. We stayed there for the weekend and had an amazing time. It is closed to all attractions, very rich night life close by. The only thing I would recommend is not to pay for parking with the hotel. Don't give them you licence plate as you can find cheaper parking at the same spot but through a different company. There is typically a guy standing at the entrance to the parking lot flagging people to take parking through him and it is a better deal, just make sure you pay for parking for the night and then some aditional change for after 7 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway Spot”
Reviews.Author: garlawn
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, smaller hotel in ideal location. We enjoyed a room with king bed and terrace (room #1804 or 1904?) Super clean, updated and stylish rooms. Walk to everything, nice, friendly staff. We arrived downstairs for breakfast a little too late, but the staff insisted we sit down and they served us anyway (and the brunch was great!). Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: lc123BC
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Park Hyatt and many other Hyatts throughout Canada and the US, my initial reaction to this hotel was that it was subpar for the Hyatt brand - small rooms, few amenities, etc. However, the service made up for any other shortcomings - frinedly front desk staff, nice waiters in the breakfast reastaurant, and staff went out of their way to assist when I left a bag in the limo that we took to the airport - they called the limo company and had the bag delivered to me at the airport within half an hour. I would recommend this hotel if you are visiting the theatre/entertainment district of Toronto for its location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: armchairgourmet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a one night stay at the Hyatt Regency Toronto. We were in town to see war horse the play. Over all the hotel was a very nice surprise. I believe it is the former Holiday Inn on King. They have done a nice job with the reno and the staff was excellent. Good job.

Reviews.Title: “Not You'd Expect”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: This property was previously a Holiday Inn. Not that's necessarily a bad thing, and the structure is very solid (I used to work in this building) but don't expect stellar accommodations. At almost $200/night, they're trying to tap into the business from the Bell Light Box next door, home to the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). While I use this hotel when I have to meet clients and friends downtown, it's overpriced for the level of accommodation. The rooms are small and the details (trim on the walls and beds) are certainly not up to "red carpet" standards. Even the front desk staff are "snooty" and not very welcoming to "the great unwashed". I'm not suggesting for a moment that you should avoid this hotel completely. I'm just saying that if you want a superior hotel then you'd be better served by other properties in the city. The King Edward immediately comes to mind, but if you're looking for a "boutique" hotel then check out the Madison Avenue Hotel (admission: I've known Isabele for quite a few years). Even the Sheraton downtown is more contemporary and their pool is available year-round. Recommendation: unless you HAVE to stay at this hotel, you might be better served by the alternatives, If I was a "big star" then I'd probably stay at the Four Seasons at Bloor and Avenue Road, but that's just me...

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: HP14
Reviews.Content: Entrance could be a bit cleaner and there were no doormen but then the price is so low that it would be unreasonable to expect them, once a holiday inn now a hyatt this was a great bargain the in the centre of Toronto, close to the city airport and with a bus stop for the main one outside, go back one block along the street and turn right or the CN tower, left for the Art Gallery of Ontario or carry on the Thompson Hall, St Andrews church and downtown. Excellent front desk staff (mostly, though totally unable to recommend somewhere local to go for a quick dinner). Huge room - decor is very dated, too too much chocolate and while some of the surfaces were dusty others were just done. Extra selling point is the roof top pool wither you can swim around and view the CN tower at the same time. Price was way less than I would expect to pay from something of this standard, in any major city so an unusually good value combination.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great for Valentines Day!”
Reviews.Author: gliu25
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for Valentines Day on priceline and got an amazing deal. I've heard a lot of good things about this hotel so I was excited to check out this hotel. This hotel was a perfect getaway with my girlfriend and it exceeded our expectations. We drove one car as reading the reviews from this site indicated that parking is quite expensive to help reduce our costs. My cousin actually lives in the area so we parked the car at her condo. If you are going to drive and park - I would recommend the parking lot across the hotel as it offers a competitive price to all the other lots in the area. The hotel was absolutely beautiful. The ambience of the hotel was amazing and the staff are extremely nice and sincere. Sam the manager checked me in and upgraded me to a balcony room which gave a beautiful view of the city line. This was perfect for valentines day and my girlfriend loved the view. Unfortunately the balcony door wasn't working so we couldn't go outside - but since this was a free upgrade, I really couldn't complain. The room was extremely spacious with a LCD TV and washroom was really clean. The bed was really comfortable and the cleaning staff were really nice. I left my phone in the room and the cleaning staff were really nice to hang on to the phone for me. One of the downsides of this hotel was that there was no refridgerator in the room but there was a safe for your valuables. We did not visit the pool or the restaurant - hence I cannot comment on it. There is a starbucks connected to the hotel which was really convenient. In all this hotel made our Valentines day memorable and I will definitely be back. If the hotel offers a competitive rate - I will definitely be coming back on a regular basis for special occasions. The only negative is the hotel charges for internet service but you can access free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: ontariogirl77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three nights while I was at a conference. The hotel has a great atmosphere and welcoming staff who are there to please. Good food in the restaurant and there is a starbucks just off the lobby which is very convenient. Everything you need is within a few blocks which means you have some of the cities best restaurants to choose from (you must try Nota Bene on Queen). The only thing I have to complain about was the bed. It was so soft that when I woke up in the morning, I was in the bed, literally! I would definately recommend some new mattresses. Other than that PERFECT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Eh... Old hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: Ferinha
Reviews.Content: My company booked conference space and a block of rooms for a North American meeting. I haven't stayed in a Hyatt in many years. I'm more of a Marriott and Hilton person. With that being said, I won't be staying in a Hyatt again unless it's done for me. The room's carpet was old and felt old. The bathroom looked as if a college sophomore had just cleaned it. It wasn't pleasant. Know when you keep thinking about a bathroom? This is what this was like. The gym was decent. Had views of buildings and newer equipment. Small for my taste, but average in the world of chain hotels. At least the gym was clean. The restaurant bar just wasn't nice. It was lit in an interesting, sterile fashion and didn't really make you want to hang out. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “'Questionable' policy at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Hyatt via the parking garage elevator, we were greeted by 'Jose' (according to his name tag) who stopped us and informed us he could not allow us any further into the hotel with the amount of alcohol we were carrying - 15 cans of beer. My first impression was that Jose was messing with us but once more we were stopped wih a raised hand and a statement about 'a policy against excessive alcohol'. ?? We asked him why there was no mention of this in the terms and conditions attached to our reservation and there wasn't a reply. My guess is that this was Jose's 'policy' and not necessarily the Hyatt's. Either way it left a bad taste in our mouths and would advise guests carrying anything more than a six-pack to conceal the remainder of the booze. Isn't this why people book a hotel in the first place? To not monitor the level of consumption since you don't have to drive?? They are also slightly misleading about the pool - it is only seasonal, closed in the winter months (no mention of this on any of the promo materials). There is also no free wi-fi at this hotel - seems sub-standard for the Hyatt line of hotels. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful desk staff, room could've been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: Mirage2011
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Priceline for this hotel. Best thing about this hotel is the location and the front desk staff. The decor is a bit weird, and our room needed a serious vacuuming and dusting. But, when we mentioned it to the desk staff the comped our parking ($30), a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: BubblesNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for one night to attend a conference that was held on site. The beds are SUPER comfortable but the rooms need a mirror in the guest room itself. When two people are in a room and one is in the bathroom, the other person is likely getting ready outside of the bathroom and needs a mirror to do so. Most hotels have a full-length mirror. This is a small nit, though. It was very clean and safe and the service was great. There are tons of restaurants to choose from across the street. I would probably stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilavati85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January of 2012 with my boyfriend for a nice night in the city. Decent hotel, but definitely not anything special. Staff - Friendly enough, didn't wow us in any way however Room - The rooms start on the ninth floor so they all have decent views. We were put on the tenth floor facing the back parking lot. This was unfortunate as I know the hotel wasn't even close to full & I'm sure they could have given us a room with a much better view (or at least on a higher floor). The room was modern & mostly clean/in good shape (we found a few stray hairs on the bed & the furnishings were a bit worn). The bathroom was nice, but there was an opaque window between the main room & the bathroom which didn't afford for much privacy (& would make it hard for someone to use the bathroom if the other person was trying to sleep). There was only one drinking glass in the room, which seemed rather odd... No fridge, & the small plastic bottles of water in the room were $4 each. Hotel - hotel itself was clean & modern. Location - seemed good, near the CN tower, lots of good restaurants, etc... (I don't really know Toronto that well...) Misc... - Parking was expensive ($20 or 30 I believe), no free wifi as others have stated, pool was closed d/t the season, but it looked very nice Overall I really wasn't impressed, especially considering how good my last experience with a Hyatt (in Vancouver) was. We did book through Priceline so perhaps they don't care as much about our business? (mind you, we did the same with the hyatt in vancouver & got fabulous service there)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Toronto G
Reviews.Content: Great location on King St W, close to clubs, restaurants and all the big event centres. Rooms were neat, although the garbage in the room hadn't been emptied and there were plastic wrappers next to the garbage. I wouldn't call the room dirty, but it certainly wasn't spic and span. On the weekends, this is definitely a loud hotel as many people choose it as a place to crash after a night of clubbing. Parking at the hotel was $29 and the staff made it sound like a deal. Drive a short distance east and you can get overnight parking for $15 (it's about a 3 minute walk back to the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Kellieg2
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Hyatt Regency in Toronto in June of 2011. The staff were courteous and helpful, the new look to the hotel was impressive and we received a free room upgrade for being Hyatt Gold Members. Well done. Will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views, but at a cost.”
Reviews.Author: JSFrench
Reviews.Content: There are many rooms at the Hyatt Regency that offer stunning views of the city and CN Tower, as well as being walking distance from the CN Tower, Steam Whistle Brewery and other attractions. Ours in particular would've been perfect except for the lighting poles and utility balcony that was obstructing the view (although I cannot blame the Hyatt for this because certainly not every room can have an unobstructed view). The decor is a modern/contemporary style and the hotel carries a subtle elegancy. The room I stayed in could use a detailed cleaning though (cobwebs, large number of marks on the walls, bathtub had some sort of film in it). The staff is courteous and friendly, and was very helpful in giving us ideas for how to get around the city as this was our first time visiting Toronto. As many others have mentioned, the parking is a stiff at $29 per night. I tried to ask the parking attendant in the basement deck about just paying them directly and they told me "If you are checking in at the hotel, you must register with them". I did, however in retrospect I suppose I never had to even mention the hotel to the parking attendant and should've just kept my mouth shut so I could just pay the $15/day. If you are a AAA member I recommend getting the breakfast package because the breakfast offered in the restaurant, although very good and beautiful plate presentation, is grossly overpriced. Overall this is a very nice hotel, I would stay again if I visited, but perhaps look into which floors have the best views and do your research about meals/parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not central location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugsEB
Reviews.Content: This is not an ideal hotel with young kids as there was no pool and the restaurant prices and deals are not geared toward families like those at Sheraton. Although the hotel lobby is nice with modern decor, the sterile and metallic feeling gives the welcoming sensation geared towards young urban professionals instead of families. Same with the room decor which is retro modern although fairly comfortable beds. The cleaning is spotty as I found damaged earrings at corner of bathroom. Would be good for business stay but a bit far for walk to bay street. The staff is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “What a Mess”
Reviews.Author: megse
Reviews.Content: I work in the hotel industry, so I tend to sympathize with the staff. However, this hotel was a pretty bad experience. The hotel actually has a horseshoe driveway in the back of the hotel - I would recommend using this entranceway, since the main King St. West entrance is frequently occupied by taxis. Our checkin in great, our agent was Gloria and she worked on the night audit team. She was fabulous. Parking at the hotel is actually roughly $25/per night. We parked somewhere else the first night. From then on the trip was nothing short of a mess. Our room keys did not work. Fine. When we got to our (two double beds), the room was cramped. They are teeny, tiny. Ditto the bathroom. There are no hooks and little counter space. Beds are luckily comfortable. We registered our car with the hotel the next day. But when we came down the next day, there was a TICKET. It turns out that the parking attendants are "ticket-happy." They decided to ticket our vehicle without checking to see that it was registered at the front desk. The front desk took care of the ticket, but it really soured our experience and I was really upset by the attitude taken by our agent. Instead of apologizing, they seemed to brush it off like it was a normal practice. Bad service. To make matters worse, our keys did not work (again) upon returning from dinner. When we went to get them reprogrammed, the agent was adamant that I had demagnetized them (they were in the hotel issued pack! and we had problems the night before!). Again, the agent seemed to insinuate that this was our problem - no apology, nothing. Again, bad service. Lastly, at 2:00am - the people next door to us had a party and decided to knock on our doors for fun. Suffice to say, the stay was TERRIBLE. At checkout the agent took care of our parking. However, I wouldn't recommend this hotel at all. There was a conference at the hotel and the whole atmosphere of the place is sterile and chaotic. There is just a cookie-cutter attitude and the service reflects this. Poor communication between different departments (night audit, parking and security) and simply abismal customer service. I would rather sleep in my car (without a ticket) than to stay here again, since I'm sure the room of the hotel is smaller than my car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: michele_from_canada
Reviews.Content: I live about an hour away from Toronto but me and my partner stayed here because we wanted a mini weekend getaway. The package included 2 tickets to Second City which is an improve stage comedy club which was also awesome. The Hyatt was easy to find with lots of underground parking. The hotel is modern and clean with 2 bars and private elevators. After 10pm they have security outside the elevators to make sure only hotel guests are allowed inside. We felt very safe! The shower in the washroom was beautiful with glass doors and limestone tiles, while the king size bed boasted at least 6 pillows and the flat screen tv was really a focal point of the room. Add the awesome view of the CN Tower outside my window and this hotel completely outdid my expectations! I'd recommend it to anyone and I'm sure I'll be back. Oh ps the neighbourhood is safe and fun with over 150 restaurants within walking distance! Makes it feel like a mini New York holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: rosato88
Reviews.Content: Spent NYE at this hotel,check in was a little it slow, but understandable given it was NYE. We had a King room which was very nice, only issue was heating wasn't working, so that made things a little uncomfortable. Great location with lots of restaurants and bars near by, everyone where we went was walking distance which was great.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the great location with extra fees...”
Reviews.Author: laff4becky
Reviews.Content: Usually travel to Toronto to visit friends but decided to stay here to be close to the "city lights"...excellent decision. Initially, I was upset that the sink was clogged, bed sheets and desk had foreign hairs (gross!) and the hotel front desk staff COMPLETELY ignored me when I was checking in...apparently I am invisible because a lady came up behind me and all 3 of them decided to end their conversation to help her check in. So I will review the hotel itself and not the unwelcoming staff... Lobby: Quite beautiful. Apparently recently renovated. Beautiful colors and modern furniture. Ordered a dirty martini for $13 at the bar. Bartender was nice. Bar fully stocked with premium wine and spirits. Elevator did not label which floor had the gym/pool...I think they should work on that one since it would be an easy fix (It's on the 17th floor by the way). The TVs in the elevator could at least say something other than "Register your car in the lobby." A directory would be nice. I did not eat at the hotel since there was a great selection of restaurants on King Street. (I DID receive complimentary fruit but didn't eat them all because they were mostly bruised) Internet: A STEEP $14/day BUT Starbucks right downstairs has FREE WIFI! And One_Zone High Speed Internet is the downtown Wifi hotspot that is usually cheaper than what Hyatt is offering. Fitness Center: State of the art fitness center with a spectacular view of the financial district. They also have a sauna in the locker rooms (a definite plus!). The equipment was new and well maintained. I actually worked out 3/4 of the time I was there. They offer headsets if you don't have one and towels. Wide variety of equipment for cardio, endurance and free weights. Maintenance staff came in about every 30 minutes to ensure cleanliness. Another plus... Rooms: I had a King. Beautiful view of the city. Other than the nasty hairs that housekeeping came to promptly clean up (and reset my room), it was very nice. Towels are kept in a cabinet under the sink (had to search for them at first). Shower has no rack to hold your towel so you have to either fling the towel over the glass door or walk into the cold bathroom across the floor to the towel rack. Toilet tissue holder was awkward, I had to take it off the holder to grab some tissue since it was somewhat free standing. The glass/window between the bathroom and bedroom kind of sucked because when hubby woke up to go to the conference and turned on the light in the bathroom, the whole room lit up...even after he closed the door. There is no way to block the window or stream of light coming from the restroom. The bed came with ample pillows though the mattress was a bit lumpy. Hubby and I ended up sleeping on the blanket and using an extra blanket from the closet to cover up with. The blanket helped smooth out the bed. There was no tv guide so we had to search for the channel listing just by flipping through to find something to watch by chance. Housekeeping was very prompt and efficient during turn down service...and very courteous (Edna was very nice :). Cooling/Heating systems in the room conveniently converts to Fahrenheit instead of Celsius. Pool: Outdoors (surprisingly for a Hyatt in the middle of a city that has predictably cold winters). It was closed but there was no hot tub either. Maybe one day they will invest in one. But there is a sauna in Male/Female locker rooms. Disappointed about the pool though... Entertainment: EVERYTHING is close by. Starbucks downstairs, Second City across the parking lot, Princess of Wales Theater (Saw Mary Poppins!), CN Tower a few blocks away, 2 blocks from St. Andrews Subway station (for shopping), Stadium down the street...EXCELLENT restaurants within walking distance. It truly was an excellent location. Parking: $29/night. Steep. Park across the street for 1/2 the price. Or at the garage across the street for about $10 less. There really is no difference in the walk across the street vs. parking in the garage downstairs that isn't even OWNED by Hyatt so...no $$ out of their pockets. OVERALL: Would definitely recommend this place to a friend. You may need to use SOME resources (parking, internet, etc.) outside of the hotel but overall, everything you need is at the hotel. It was an excellent location for a conference as there was one going on while I was there and there was no real 'crowd' in the lobby that made it apparent. the guests vs. conference visitors never really got in the way of each other. The hotel rooms start on the 9th floor so everyone pretty much has a great chance of getting a nice room with a view. I haven't stayed at a Hyatt that I did not like.

Reviews.Title: “Has Hyatt Slipped?”
Reviews.Author: Throbbert
Reviews.Content: I used to work for Hyatt some 20+ years ago, and at the time they were a class hotel. But upon staying at the Hyatt Regency Toronto, it seems their standards have slipped. This is a former Holiday Inn, and it seems Hyatt purchased it, fancied up the lobby, and slapped their logo on it. The majority of issues lie in the room. They feel dated, tired, and exceptionally 80s. The water pressure on my bathroom shower was poor and half the water fell vertically rather than spray out. I had to call housekeeping as there was an ironing board but no iron. The headboard is a curved arch so you can't lean against the headboard to work or watch TV. And the decor is, well, rather 80s. There was also black body hair on my bed before I had climbed in (on the comforter, not the sheets). Despite setting my thermostat to 80 degrees, the room always felt cold. The lobby was different. Check-in seemed efficient, and the staff was friendly. It's a pleasant place to be. I did have connectivity issues with the Internet and I was never able to log in to the 30-minutes of complimentary Internet lobby use. All the incidentals in this hotel did seem to add up quickly. Overall, the stay was sufficient, but I would expect a little more of the rooms from Hyatt and would prefer the nickle and diming for everything be minimized.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms, very high-end looking”
Reviews.Author: Jack L
Reviews.Content: The building looks a bit old, but the inside and rooms were amazing. Exactly like the picture. Great for couples or groups. Gave us a complimentary fruit basket. Parking is expensive, need to do a bit more research next time to see if anything was cheaper. No free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Gamelanlover
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that treats business travellers well, this is the place. I arrived late at night after a long flight from Asia- luggage missing. When I arrived, the staff were immediately understanding and gave me a large bag of toiletries to use until my baggage arrived. They asked me if I wanted to wait until morning to receive my baggage, if the airline brought my bags during the night. I requested immediate delivery, and sure enough, the bags were delivered at 5AM to my room. With an excellent breakfast, attentive staff, and a central location, I highly recommend this hotel to business and leisure travellers wanting to be central in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - But the rooms had a lot of issues”
Reviews.Author: dak1124
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a result of Priceline when we spent the night in Toronto. The Hotel is in a nice part of the City, where we were seemed safe. When checking in, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the process was quick. Elevators to and from the room were very fast as well. We were to our room in no time. The rooms are decorated a bit ultra modern for my taste and the room was a bit old. Our closet door was broken, and the bathroom showed signs of age. We did not end up spending any major time in the room because we were out on the town and got back late, but we did have some issues trying to sleep in the room. The room was very hot, and though there was a thermostat, any adjustments we made did not cause the ac/heating system to cool or reduce the temperature in the room. When I went to call the front desk, our room phone did not work. It was 2:30 am and we did not feel like getting dressed to go downstairs so we lived with it Also the hotel has a quiet floor policy after 10pm, where there are no visitors allowed so that the floors can be quiet. Around 4am we had quite a ruckus with a group of young men being very loud in the halls. I'm not sure if they were staying or visiting, but when I opened my door and confronted them on the noise, they seemed to disperse back towards the elevators. It is still a very nice hotel, and perhaps rooms with problems are given to priceline customers, I'm not sure. But if I had gotten room with working temp controls, working phone, and in a quieter part of the hotel I may have rated the place higher.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views”
Reviews.Author: joeyboy79
Reviews.Content: Good modern hotel, busy hotel and can be noisy given its location to nightlife and young crowd. Would recommend if looking to go out on the town in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend !”
Reviews.Author: tashsolo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last night and I couldn't wait to give my review ! This hotel was great and exceeded our expectations.. It's not the fanciest but it is nice and modern. Aaaand the location is extremely convenient- restaurants, banks, stores around every corner ! The decor of the lobby was nice and modern and so was the decor of the rooms. The rooms were decent sized (considering that they are downtown... We weren't expecting anything too large), nice and very clean- as well as the washroom. The beds were extremely comfortable.. And we also appreciated the fact that the heater worked and worked well ! My only suggestion would be to have better staff in the lobby. The lobby is the first place a guest sees and our first impression in terms of staff wasn't horrible nor the greatest... And a suggestion for a driving guest is to go with the hotel parking ! Its 29$, but its underground- away from potential car-jacking and its until 4o'clock the next afternoon !

Reviews.Title: “The little charges kill you....”
Reviews.Author: mikeh141
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my wife to watch a taping of the Vinyl Cafe at the Sony Centre. The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of the entertainment district, and restaurants are just outside the front door. The rooms are nice, although the furniture is a little over the top. The showers are fantastic. All things considered, as a hotel, it's a nice place. The problem was with the charge for parking. You park under the hotel in a public lot, and hte hotel offers a parking option which seems convenient. They'll just charge the parking to your room. No need to worry about the pay and display. What they don't tell you, is that they charge $29 for this service. Had we chosen to simply pay at the pay station, the same parking would have cost just $13. That's simply not right. And it would cause me to look at other options before even considering this hotel again. Losing a $150/night hotel room customer by gouging me on the parking is a poor business plan.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this hotel are the friendliest i've seen in Toronto in years.”
Reviews.Author: George_Fido
Reviews.Content: Although I thought it was a little far from Metro Centre, the location is actually not bad. Good restaurants and clubs around. Parking isn't the best but the staff at this hotel are amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, funtional hotel”
Reviews.Author: RefreshinglyFrank
Reviews.Content: Given a choice of any hotel in Toronto, I doubt I would chose this one. The wireless was a little funky having to remember to write down the access code to get your $15 a day access seems a little cludgy. The rooms are very small, the lighting just okay. The Starbucks in the lobby is excellent as is the proximity to many excellent restaurants outside the hotel. The entrace is awkward, with stairs off the street level, or having to go around the corner and through the parking drop off for no stairs. No real concierge service, or if there was I didn't go at a time they were engaged. Pretty much seems like it's still a Holiday Inn with a laminate veneer and expensive wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: More or less a standard Hyatt Regency. But with problems. (1) The TV was difficult to operate. Hint: hold down the "on" button on the remote for several seconds. (2) The free lobby internet did not work. (3) Due to ill design, it is simply impossible to adjust the shower without getting wet. (4) The TV was large, which only made more unpleasant the low definition signal being fed to the high definition TV. Hint: avoid the exorbitantly expensive breakfast by dining in the Starbucks attached to the library (and get functioning free internet as well). Exercise area small but adequate with a really great view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good proximity to Toronto Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: AKo75
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel for business. Overall, the rooms are functional for a business trip with a comfortable bed and an average size desk. The location is great because of the local restaurants on the streets which were great (Canteen and Brassaii - thumbs up). The King Street Social (the restaurant inside the hotel) is on the expensive side for the quality and quantity of food. So if you have time, I would recommend the minute walk to a restaurant that surrounds the hotel. The first time I stayed I had a very slow draining tub. Since I only stayed one night, I complained at the end of the stay, and they graciously comped my internet charge (yes, no free WiFi).

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit tired.”
Reviews.Author: realtorav8tor
Reviews.Content: Being downtown it was fairly close to everything, especially some pretty good restaurants just minutes away along Front St. The hotel is tired but clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and welcoming. It would have been nice to have a paper in the morning and a bill under the door. $29 for parking and small bathrooms and a needed facelift are negatives. I booked through Hotwire and the price was ok but had I paid the full price it would not have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tcambridge
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency and had a wonderful experience . The hotel is well kept and maintained, the staff were incredible ! They were very friendly and accomdating and went out of their way to help us. We would defanetly stay here again. We had a great sleep, and for a hotel in the entertainment district you would expect to hear alot of noise, we never heard anything all night. When we mentioned it in the morning while checking out they told us that they strongly enforce the noise levels. I think all hotels should do this, There's nothing worse than paying to sleep at a hotel, and not getting any sleep. Overall our stay was wonderful and we will be back in January !!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Meggmobb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend over the weekend for one night. I can honestly say that from the moment we walked in till we check out we recieved the best customer service I have ever recieved in any hotel in Toronto. The hotel was incredibly busy with many people checking in as well as a very loud and somewhat wild Christmas party was taking place at the hotel lounge/bar. The staff did not seem stressed out and if they were they did not reflect it upon their guests. I believe the person who check us in was named Chris and he was very friendly and helpful.... I would also like to point out that my friend and I are in our early to mid twenties and normally when I check into a hotel we do not recieve the same service because we are younger- and this was not the case at the Hyatt Regencey. ROOM: Our room was a standard two queen room with an amazing city view. The beds were comfy and big and the bathroom was clean. I loved the futuristic style of the decor too! A plus was the ipod dock and a negative was there was no fridge! Big time let down... but there is an ice machine on every floor so we made do! LOCATION: was amazing. close to everything a 20 something could want!! Lots of resturants, bars, LCBO, shoppers drug mart.... I walked everywhere from the hotel and it never took more than 15 minutes Other little points... Many people have mentioned on here that guests were given a hard time when trying to enter the hotel... we have 3 guests come into our room and we never were hasseled. I mentioned upon check in that we would have a few guests come for a visit and explained we would eb quiet and respectful and we had no issues!! So if you plan on having guests over, just let them know at check in. I am just thrilled with the service we recieved and would stay here again in a heartbeat! Thanks to the staff that made us feel so welcomed :) We did score an AMAZING deal on Priceline.com but I would pay a regular room rate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Business Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elliot S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in at the Hyatt Regency for four nights. The staff is friendly and accommodating, but someone who understands the basic needs of business travelers needs to reorient the place. The Internet system fails constantly and at best is slow and erratic. There were no newspapers available and our bill was not under our door the night before to speed check out. The bathroom was terribly small with no hooks to hang towels. All in all, not a good hotel--more worthy of a Holiday Inn than the Hyatt brand. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Despicable”
Reviews.Author: Virgo531
Reviews.Content: The beautiful hotel, the well-mannered front desk assisting staff and the fairly cozy room are eradicated by the highly unprofessional managerial staff. Having been to many hotels in Toronto and over the world, I can undeniably state that this is the single place where I experienced the worst customer service. Upon our return to the hotel from a dinner, my colleagues and I were denied access to our room. Without explaining the root of the problem, the manager, Lisa Joseph, spoke very rudely to us and threatened to evict us from the hotel. She became angry within seconds when we attempted to inquire about the aforementioned problem. She went so far as to accuse my companion of being intoxicated and refusing to listen to our words. Customer service is the greatest asset (or liability) that a hotel can have. This hotel staff's lack of that is distressing. Horrible place to book for a group of people.

Reviews.Title: “Worst expierence ever”
Reviews.Author: Roseb77
Reviews.Content: Over priced room and extremely rude staff!! Was celebrating a birthday and anniversary with a couple of friends and left the hotel to get some dinner - when we returned all of my friends were refused entry to the room! Not even allowed to go up to grab coats and personal belongings! It was the most embrassing expierence of life being turned away at the door and treated more like a criminal than a guest! I stood at the elevators and watched as they let other groups in without question.. When I said something to the staff I was Rudely told to move from the area and was told that if I didn't they would evict me and call the cops! I've had suites at some of Toronto's best hotels and this was by far the worst expierence ever. I've never met such a rude staff! Unexceptable for a 4 star hotel! Completely ruined my special night and left me in tears! I can't even explain in words how bad I felt and how rude the staff was especially since I paid good money to be in a suite! This hotel does not appreciate their guests or the business we give them - do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “TWO NIGHTS IN TORONTO”
Reviews.Author: BANDISanRafaelCa
Reviews.Content: I stayed more than 30 Hyatt Regencies around the world many times but I never had such a bad experience until Toronto. Check in time is at 4:00PM. However we had to wait unti 4:20 to get a room. The bathroom is so small that only one person can be in at a time. No counter-space at all. The bathtub is slippery, you can not hold on to anything. There is no hoock in the bathroom to hang on anything. Two phones in the room but only one was working. They charge for internet access $14.95 a day. (Most of the hotels at that level provide free Intenet access). They have smoking floores. One idiot triggered a fire alarm middle of the night, kept us 20 minutes under evecuation order for nothing. I am a Hyatt Gold Passport holder more that 25 years. I will never stay in this hotel in the future and recommend to stay in an other hotel if you visiting Toronto. Bandi

Reviews.Title: “Good for personal visits; not so hot for conventioneers”
Reviews.Author: MCHBurgess
Reviews.Content: Checking in for a convention was easy peasy. Trying to find the loading dock and get an elevator to work for all the gear I had to take to the convention floor was stunningly, mesmerizingly difficult. Staff appeared not to have a clue, and my requests for information and assistance were passed on to different staff members - from reception to security to finally, after a frustrating hour, somebody in maintenance, who found a key to a freight elevator. Well, the room was good and the price was fair. A good little bar on the first floor, too. The nice thing about the hotel is that it's very close to downtown amenities, and Gretzky's Bar is around the corner. Here's a reco: The Wayne Gretzky Estates Winery products, available at the restaurant, are really, really good. The winemaker is Rob Power of Creekside Estates, Jordan Station ON. Reds and whites equally appealing, well made. Caution: the unoaked chardonnay is particularly quaffable.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms, spectacular views, friendly staff & downtown convenience.”
Reviews.Author: gwheele1
Reviews.Content: Feng Shui is in full effect throughout the lobby with indoor waterfalls and generous seating areas. The front desk utilizes half height counters that seem to make the staff more accessible and enhances their friendliness and commitment. The rooms are beautifully designed to maximize space and take full advantage of the spectacular views. Streetcars and other public transportation are right outside. The CN Tower and Rogers Centre are only a couple blocks away. The world famous Second City Comedy club is right across the street along with many excellent restaurants and nightclub choices. If not for some elevator issues, I would have rated this hotel Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Toronto: Always a great stay at a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Diamond_Girl88_11
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is "where the action is" in Toronto's Theatre District! It's a great place to stay if walking to great sites, restaurants and theatre is the purpose of your trip. It's got a very modern feel. The staff are professional and efficient. Frankly, it's my husband's favourite for business stays in Toronto! Our 12th Floor room offered the kind of bed we never wanted to get out of! And a wonderful 42" plasma TV with cable/satellite made for a bit of relaxing 'channel-surfing!' The room decor offers excellent lighting, especially the headboard with built-in lights - a joy for reading in bed! The bathrooms were delightfully modern, offering frosted glass walls allowing a small room to seem large due to lots of light. The huge, walk-in shower and it's rain-shower massage showerhead was treat to be sure!! The amenties made us feel pampered: coffeemaker with great coffee and Tazo tea, generously-sized Portico white ginger bath amenities, and an iPod stereo with iPodÂ® docking station with multi-media interface that allowed me to play my MP3s. Because we rendevous-ed with other family members, we got to check out their rooms, so I can share that the rooms offer great views of the city (IMHO...I was born in Toronto-it all looks good to me!). I had chance to check out of one of the King-bed Suites, which was fabulously modern and had skylights and a great sitting room! Since I know the neighbourhood, it's easy to get to many of Toronto's great attractions either by walking, public transit, or cab-bing it. Parking, checking-in/out and access to hotel are pretty easy compared to other Toronto Hotels. The hotel provides great security to ensure safety & security after 10 p.m. Have read some of the reviews mentioning the full-price rates, so I'd recommend using the Internet to book and save on regular rates. Also, we've found signing up for the loyalty program will bring upgrades and other benefits. We'd definitely stay there again! Here's the website for photos! http://torontoregency.hyatt.com/hyatt/hotels/

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: KLoveToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights while work was being done on my home. Was able to get the room for $149 (very reasonable by downtown Toronto standards). Checkin was efficient, the room was clean and comfortable (great shower by the way) and I slept great. That was the sum total of my experience with the hotel - exactly what I needed at a fair price. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel. Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Pom H
Reviews.Content: Simply does what is advertised. Rooms are fresh, functional and to a high standard. Location is excellent for down town, lots of restaurants in the area. Breakfast was a high quality buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DoubleEh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night via priceline. Got a great rate so my review is generally positive. 1. The beds are very comfortable. 2. After 10pm you have to show your hotel card to get to your room and register any guests. That's a little unnecessary but it didn't matter as I didn't have any guests. 3. Great location near Rogers centre, bell lightbox. Everything is within walking distance. I'd stay here again but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a view”
Reviews.Author: jennipoo-nurse
Reviews.Content: Luxurious room, comfortable king bed, view of CN Tower from the bed, in the center of the city, close to all attractions. Great restaurant for breakfast buffet. A nice getaway for a night, to spoil ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marriedinmexico
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency October 2011. The hotel is in the perfect location.. close to bars/ACC/waterfront/Theatres/great restaurants. Our room seemed a little run down for the "Hyatt" repuation and the price but overall a nice hotel. Still prefer Weston Harbour Castle but can't beat the location of Hyatt. Parking $29.00 / night

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star hotel that just holds up ...”
Reviews.Author: LondonLockwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and found the hotel to be fine. Its more of a business hotel to be fair with lots of conference rooms on the 1st floor and all were busy during our stay.Coudnt fault the reception ..we were seen immediately and the rooms were of reasonable size so no problem there.Bathrooms could have been bigger and my wife likes the idea of a bathrobe etc which were not forthcoming. The house forgot our towels one day but were replaced immediately.The real plus for me here is the location.It site plum centre of the "entertainment district " and within 5 mins walk we had the choice of 50 plus restaurants and bars.Also the Air Canada Centre ( Hockey and Basketball Arena ) were no more than a 10 min walk and you should catch a game if possible..its a great experience ! So for me it was fine and would return for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine if you're in a pinch but wouldn't recommend. No bath!!”
Reviews.Author: Murdochsroomate
Reviews.Content: I had do make a quick overnight trip into Toronto last night and discovered the room rates for the night were almost twice the usual going rate, so I decided to try my luck on Priceline and ended up at the Hyatt. Note to self: any hotel that has to Priceline it's rooms on a night that others are selling at a premium is probably not a hotel you really want to stay at. Don't get me wrong. The rooms are clean and trendily decorated. But they are small; the finishes are cheap and showing signs if wear; and -- most offensively -- there is no bath tub!! And I was told I was upgraded to a "room with a view" (of King St.). I hate to see a non-upgrade room. Also, not even a newspaper in the morning, a missing toilet bolt seemed to have been filled in with caulk, there was a rusty orange stain on some of the shower tiles on the floor -- as if a metal surface underneath had coroded -- and I found the mattress too firm. Between that and not being able to unwind in a nice hot bath before bed, I really didn't sleep well at all. None of the Hyatt's sins would be particularly offensive if the hotel was listed as a three star, but it's not. And how it got that extra star is beyond me. If I'd known what it was like, i'd've just paid the almost $100 more to stay in the three star hotel I normally stay at. At least then I could've had a nice bath in a well-maintained bathroom, and the price would've gotten me a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: zebra1ny
Reviews.Content: At first glance hotel looks nice, but on further inspection it's a bit shabby around the edges. Stayed during a girlfriend's birthday getaway. Cons: - No ramp to roll luggage into hotel, must carry luggage up several steps. - $1.00 per local phone call - Overpriced breakfast Bathroom: - small, not enough shelf space for toiletries and makeup - poor lighting - one small towel rail in entire bathroom, my girlfriend had to throw her towel over shower rod. No place to hang washcloth. Ridiculous - no soap dish - no grab rail - no hook for bathrobe or clothes Room: - poorly lit; difficult to read anything; light above bed was out, called front desk, promptly someone arrived, jiggled light, it came on but went out again; did not bother calling since it did not enhance the quality of lighting in the room. - could have been cleaner, pieces of wrapped hard candy [I suppose from previous guests], were in randomly odd places on shelves. - no luggage stand for suitcases - called front desk, specifically requested TWO, only ONE was delivered, had to requested another which was delivered. Pros: - good location - good price [thanks to priceline] - 2 queen beds - overall look is sleek, uncluttered - pleasant attractive lobby area - comfortable bed w/ good quality 100% cotton sheets, down comforter - fitness/workout room on 17th floor is clean, towels provided, well-equipped w/ machines, free weights, lots of other fitness items - staff relatively pleasant, somewhat accommodating - well-stocked pharmacy near hotel - easy airport connection via airport bus - restaurants, shopping, many sites nearby or within walking distance Overall it's an "okay" hotel but definitely there's lots of room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blksnapper
Reviews.Content: First, getting a name wrong a person's reservation is acceptable until check in. However after check in with the verification of identification and the name is still is incorrect is not acceptable. I was on business travel with 2 rooms, the wrong name just don't cause problems for the final bills on check out to claim as a business expense but also during you stay the correct name and room # is require to access the internet. Parking was the usual downtown $30 per night but the staff and administration has the most convenient designated parking spots on the 1st level while guest have to drive around in circles to find a parking spot. We went out to for dinner and on return we had to go through a poor excuse for security check point at the elevators, where we were just supposed to show a room key that many guest can easily keep from their last stay, but this was the access to the get back to our rooms. Further more a couple of business partners came back for a quit chat and a nite cap and we were charged an outrageous cover charge of $25 per person for my colleagues to come up to my room. I thought i had checked into the Hyatt as a hotel didn't know the hotel turned into a night club after 2200hrs. Rooms were nothing special and have no amenities but a coffee pot and a ice bucket. felt like I was in motel rather than a downtown hotel. On Check A/C didn't work so the room was very warm, there was no alarm clock in the room to my surprise the next morning when i was looking for the time. Floor were poorly vacuumed. Guest info directory provided no information for guest except for 90 percent of the binder being menus for the hotel restaurant and room service. Very very poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: Ramona02
Reviews.Content: My sister in laws and I stayed here for two nights on a girls trip. As stated the location is great and right in the theatre district. The lobby is really cool with the waterfall and bench seating. It was very relaxing drinking my Starbucks coffee (located in lobby of hotel), reading and people watching. The lobby bar is a great start to our evening out. The view of the city skyline is awesome! The beds are comfortable. The rooms are modern. Shower is nice too. Check in and out smooth and quick. It was easy to get a cab out with the taxi stand right outside. Car service to airport was quickly arranged. Front desk staff very helpful. Drawbacks: 1) no free Internet in lobby. This is different for me. I have stayed in many Toronto downtown hotels where it was free and also other high end hotels in North America. 2) the breakfast buffet was cold and tasteless.

Reviews.Title: “Great central downtown location”
Reviews.Author: mpsrent
Reviews.Content: Keep it mind, this hotel was a Holiday Inn so the rooms are just standard size. Hyatt has upgraded the furnishings. If you can get a room at a good price e.g. Priceline, Expedia etc. this hotel is a good deal as the location is excellent with many city attractions, restaurants and pubs nearby. If you intend to pay top dollar, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, centrally located -- and a deal on priceline!”
Reviews.Author: londongirl
Reviews.Content: This sleek, modern hotel is centrally located on King Street in the heart of the theatre district. Absolutely perfect location for the Royal Alexandra and Princess of Wales Theatre. The rooms are well equipped and have stunning views over the city. Sadly, the rooftop pool closed in early September (grr!) so we were unable to use it. I bid on priceline for this hotel and got it for $80 + tax, which was a savings of over 50%.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Gamelanlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiance in July 2011. While the location was very convenient for us- not only for visiting the attractions and proximity to family, we found that the room seemed a bit tired. As other reviewers noted, some finer details were missing or not attended to. Perhaps the most significant observation- The bathrooms could use a makeover. Small and boxy with no counter area to keep toiletries. The lobby entry area is also a bit unique, it definitely has the feel of a "city" hotel. I thought that the pool on the 11th floor (I think that's where it was) was nicely appointed with attractive sitting areas. Service was very good- we had no trouble arranging a car to take us to the airport, and our needs were attended to very well. I'll be staying there again next week, and will post an update on Trip Advisor, although I guess I won't be using the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler87
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this hotel. I stayed for 2 nights, and had a very pleasant stay. The lobby is beautiful, with plenty of couches and lounges. Check in was fast, the staff was very pleasant. My room was extremely large, and the bed was very comfortable. The inset lights and curved walls gave the room a very modern feel, very unique and quirky. The bathroom was pretty, with granite and nice tiles, and very clean. There was great water pressure from the shower (there is no tub). I visited the gym, which was very nice and clean, with a great view of the surrounding area. The roof-top outdoor pool was also great, again amazing view. This hotel is also very close to various restaurants and attractions, the location is hard to beat. I had an early morning departure, and called to ask for a cab. I showed up at the front desk 5 minutes ahead of the planned time and the cab driver was already waiting at the door. Great service, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “My reference hotel in Toronto (3 stays) but some details noticed”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_maple_leaf
Reviews.Content: It was my third stay and I have always refered to the Hyatt Regency as my reference hotel for week ends in Toronto. Being in the theater district and within walking distance from the CN tower, it offers great possibilities for city walks in downtown Toronto and get to the main city attractions easily. However, on my third stay last april, I found that rooms were less taken care of. Despite an always very good ultra modern look that I particularly like, there were many stains and cuts on the white leather sofas. I always found the rooms well sound proof during each stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for location”
Reviews.Author: MTBOttawa
Reviews.Content: Definitely would stay here again. Great location in Toronto. The room rate was more that half what near by hotels were charging. Staff cheerful and happy to help. Room was modern and unique. The lobby was inviting and good spot to wind down. Nearby to restaurants and Toronto's fashion and art district. There is a Milestones near by that is probably the best in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: guybeachbum
Reviews.Content: In terms of the location, hotel is situated perfectly on King St West. Close to basically everything you could want to walk to. The hotel has been updated (from it's old title as a Holiday Inn), and they modernized the building and brought it up to a higher standard. The rooms are "unique" to say the least. Again, while they have been updated the design of the furniture/consoles/storage is somewhat intrusive and overwhelming given the size of the room. But hey, I was there for a bachelor party so it didn't really bother me. The price was right, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance, but well located and superficially nice”
Reviews.Author: GaryP123
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the Hyatt Regency. It's a nice initial impression and certainly a comfortable room. It is a lot more expensive than it deserves. Basically, in the common areas, it is a good business hotel that is masquerading as a fine hotel. It has the necessities but it's clear this is a remodeled Holiday Inn. Once arriving at the guest suites, they are efficient and visually pleasant, however, the attention again is to style over substance. There are four drawers that are very small, sock drawer size rather than meant for the rest of one's clothing. The bed has a comfortable mattress, however, the frame around the bed places the mattress far away from the headboard and the lighting system makes it somewhat difficult to read in bed. The furniture is modern but very impractical. The tv is 58" or so and framed by a wood frame with a light above that is probably 2 feet wide on every side, room that could have been used for more stowage but is just a frame. The attention to this remodel was style, whereas a little substance would have been useful. The hotel is well located in the heart of the social scene and for that, it will be booked regularly. However, for the price, this hotel was fairly expensive relative to staying a subway stop or two away. Friends stayed two stops away for 1/3 the price. Also, it did not excite me to know that on the third morning I forgot to take my ipod out of the dock station by the bed and put it in the safe and by the time the maid cleaned the room (hint), it was stolen. The hotel took the report but did nothing and there was only one other person in my room. The elevators were extremely slow and this hotel is not very handicap accessible for that reason if it's a concern to anyone reading this. Also, the desk staff were very nice but did not have the location knowledge that on would expect when paying 4-5 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfortable room with a view”
Reviews.Author: sptravelers5
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hyatt Regency cannot be better. We parked our car in the garage and walked everywhere in town. There are scores or restaurants and bars within a few blocks. We had a very nice room with a great view of the CN tower and downtown Toronto. My only complaint is the expensive parking: $29.

Reviews.Title: “Overall it's decent”
Reviews.Author: banb
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Priceline and got a good price. I would have been disappointed if I had paid full price, especially given the extra/expensive parking rate and lack of free wi-fi. The decor in the room and common areas is modern and lovely. Bed was comfortable. It's the little things that are missing though -- our shower never functioned properly (poor pressure, sudden temperature changes) and we had to ask for some of the basics like replacement towels. Staff were very courteous and helpful. For a 4-star rating, those things should be automatic. Location is great if you want to be near entertainment, restaurants, sights, public transportation and the QEW. Nothing beats the energy of downtown TO.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in theater district”
Reviews.Author: Michebill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Nice decor. Efficient staff. Good selection for breakfast. Great lobby bar. Waking distance to restraints, bars, and train station.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves a miss because of lack of attention to details”
Reviews.Author: Matthew C
Reviews.Content: Though the place is superficially nice looking and well located, poor attention to details in the way it's both designed and run make it a miss. On the design side: - corridors are confusing; hard to find your room - a lot of street noise gets in, even on the 11th floor - water doesn't maintain a consistent temperature (I thought hotels had solved this) - room was small, and looked smaller because of curved design - shower stall constructed so that you had to get cold and wet reaching the controls - no full length mirror On the day to day operation side: - bad coffee (though there's a starbucks attached to the lobby - toilet not adjusted properly, sink partly stuffed up, - batteries in TV remote just about dead (so you have to keep pushing the buttons over again) - no newspapers - fitted sheets not fitted properly - kept coming off

Reviews.Title: “Pros: It's in the Entertainment District; Cons: It's in the Entertainment District!”
Reviews.Author: cambridgechica
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. Many sites and neighborhoods are within walking distance, i.e., Rogers Centre, Second City, Queen St, clubs, restaurants, etc., and if you need to hop on the subway or trolley, they're not far away either. (By the way, if you're going to get tickets to a show at Second City, show them your room key, and they'll give you a 20% discount!) However, for the same reason--because it's central and gets a lot of traffic--it gets kind of noisy there. Our room was on the 9th floor and was facing King Street, and I could hear all the honking, sirens, blasting stereos, etc. from the street. On Friday and Saturday night, there were a lot of (drunk) people out, and I could hear yelling and screaming until about 4 am. If you're a light sleeper, I would recommend bringing some ear plugs! Everything about the hotel, though, is very good. We were upgraded to a suite, and it was modern, roomy, and clean, with a nice view of the CN Tower. I especially loved the jacuzzi bathtub in our bathroom. My friends, however, weren't as lucky. They checked in to a room that had a dirty sock under the comforter and used coffee still in the coffee maker. But the staff made up for it by offering them complimentary breakfast during their stay. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here, and I wouldn't mind staying here again next time I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, awful parking and bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: MrsMaytag
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location in Toronto but was totally caught off guard when we arrived and had to self park in a hotel lot that had few spots in it. How they use the parking lot is beyond me. Had to travel down 7 levels to find one of 2 spots available. How Hyatt functions here is beyond me. The bathrooms are tiny as can be. One can tell this used to be a Holiday Inn! Even in a suite the room was awful. Otherwise the staff is friendly and you're treated to Hyatt hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Rooms somewhat small, but decorated nicely and roof top pool great for kids.”
Reviews.Author: lori p
Reviews.Content: Great location. Easy to get around from hotel. Starbuck's in the lobby. Food and drink expensive, but to be expected in a Hyatt. Decor very city like. Rooms were clean, beds comfortable. Parking $29/day, internet $15/day

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: tonitone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and, upon entering the lobby, it looks really nice inside. Rooms are OK, not the most spacious but clean and comfortable. Location is great - it's right in the thick of things on King Street and it's a short walk down to the water. Room service was definitely lower than average - took ages to get a hold of anyone and nobody was really willing to help. I would say that this is what usually sets a Hyatt apart from other hotels, but the great customer service is certainly lacking at this hotel. Front desk was great though. One final thing - there was a really strong smell of chlorox when we entered the room - i believe from the chemicals that they use in the sheets. We called down to complain and the reply was that we should have called ahead to instruct them not to use the chemicals in the sheets! I found this quite comical, as how the hell were we supposed to know about this strong chemical smell beforehand? Has never happened in any other Hyatt we have ever stayed in and was not dealt with well at all.

Reviews.Title: “started off poorly ...ended up great”
Reviews.Author: KitchenerWelshguy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online. We were going to a play on the weekend, and this partcular Hyatt was smack dab in the middle of the entertainment district in Toronto. Very convenient. I had a business meeting in Toronto on Monday, and my wife was going home to Kitchener on Sunday. We showed up at 2 PM on Saturday, ``Room wasn`t ready yet`` says the front desk. Well, it was supposed to be, but we were hungry and so off we went for lunch. Got back at 3:30 .....still no room, and a lot of furrowed brows. ``Dusty`` ...the lady at the front desk ....said relax for a bit. She would investigate. OK .... toddled off to the bar to have a beer. Fiftten minutes later, Dusty came over with profound apologies. Even though we had confirmed reservations, there was no regular room for us. SO !!!! .....She puts in an excutive suite on the top floor of the hotel which had a glorious view of the city ....AND ....charged us the standard room rate, which is about a quarter of the rate of the suite. The suite itself was as large as the downstairs of our house. Huge living and dining area ...seperate bedroom .... big shower the size of a meat locker. We had two flat screen TV`s ...one in the living area and one in the bedroom. The decor would probably not be to everyone`s taste .... kind of hyper modern. We liked it, but again, probably not everyone would. We ordered room service a couple of times ...who wouldn`t in a room like that? Menu was varied, the food was pretty good, and the service prompt. Read the fine print of the menu ...gratuity is included in the price of the meal. Bottom line, we had such a great time my wife staid a day longer. I don`t know what the standard rooms are like, but I was impressed with how the hotel responded to a mix-up. Next time we catch a play in Toronto, we`ll definately stay at the Hyatt ...and hope they lose our reservation again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardY
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency in downtown Toronto. This hotel is on King St West and across from many restaurants, bars and clubs. Toronto's famous Second City and Gretzky's bar were only a block way I didnt watch any shows but the hotel was within 5 minutes walk of the city's popular theatres and Roy Thompson Hall. Toronto's new Filmfest building is actually right next to the hotel. The convention center was actually 2 streets south of the hotel, very convenient and would have been only about a 10 minute walk The guestroom was very well designed and had lots of lighting, i've stayed at hotels where the rooms dont have enough lighting, it feels too gloomy. Very clean and well maintained. The service at the hotel was great from the valet parking attendant to the agents at front desk and the servers at the restaurant the hotel also has a nice bar, we had a quick drink there. and we also enjoyed their breakfast buffet the next day, lots of great healthy selection. For added convenience, there's a Starbucks next to the hotel lobby :) 2 thumbs up for this hotel, highly recommended. I will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Great location - if you're into partying”
Reviews.Author: rtdunne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. Next to bars, the best restaurants of TO, Union Station, CN Tower, Rogers center, shopping, etc. The atmosphere upon entering is fantastic and staff were very courteous. There is a beautiful rooftop patio and pool. The gym is bigger and better than any other hotel gym I have set foot in. The room we stayed in was quite spacious (although we did get the whirlpool suite). The first day the bathtub was still dirty, there was soap scum and a ring around the tub. The second day it had been cleaned and was useable. When I started the tub jets I smelled something burning so I turned it off. Perhaps the smell was dust from lack of use? The bed was super comfortable but strangely enough there was no sheet between you and the duvet so I am putting my trust in the hotel that the duvet is laundered EVERY time. BE WARNED there is quite the young party crowd in this hotel. In fact it was a little obnoxious on every turn there were partiers and loudness/disrespect. I would not return to this hotel with my young child. In fact, the smoke alarm went off at 3am (I see now in the reviews that this happened last weekend as well), a complete evacuation of the hotel. I am assuming it is from one drunk guy who decided to smoke or pull the fire alarm. Nonetheless I was very saddened to see young children roused in the middle of the night to stand on the street at 3 am. I would have been furious had my child have been with me. One final point about this: the fire alarm doesn't sound like a fire alarm. It sounds like a subway "the doors are closing" bell. A quicker reaction from patrons would no doubt ensue with a more stereotypical fire alarm sound. If you are going to stay here and are not going to be part of the 2 am entertainment district croud I highly suggest that you choose a room not on King Street and that you stay on a lower floor so that it's less distance to travel down the emergency stairs when the fire alarm goes off.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: allanng2004
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Toronto at the beginning of August after a hectic six-day packaged tour of the East Coast. The Hyatt Regency is located in downtown Toronto. It is only a stoneâ€™s throw from the financial district, and there are a number of restaurants across the street. Our twin-bed room was a bit small, especially after we unpacked our three suitcases. Another frustration was that there were only four small drawers. Although the furnishing was modern and decent, the positioning of some of the furniture was awkward, further limiting the usable space. There is a small swimming pool at the top of the hotel, and the locker room is also small and basic. Overall, itâ€™s a decent place, but not impressive. I might add that I didnâ€™t pay for our room, but converted my Hyatt Gold Passport points for the three-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not really 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Chaunier
Reviews.Content: We found the design of the hotel lacking in thoughfulness and basic convenience. e.g. the street entrance has no ramp (though we later found the car entrance is barrier-free, but out of sight at the back). The bathroom is too small for a couple, lacking any hooks of shelves for toiletries. The halogen lights above the bed shine right into our eyes when we're lying on the bed, etc... For $250/nt, they charge $4 for a small bottle of water that should be provided free!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: danjordan98
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, room was beautiful, as was roof top pool. Unfortunately, there were a couple of things that spoiled our stay. First being the fire alarm that went off at two in the morning. I know there is nothing they can do about that, still it wasn't very fun and it would have been nice if while everyone was waiting for the elevator to go back up, some complimentary water was offered as we did have to wait for nearly an hour. The second thing was the couple of drunks in the hallway yelling to each other at 4am just after having got back to sleep. Again, not that there is anything the hotel could do about that, but still it all rather spoiled an anniversary stay.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Christina T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency with my husband and six-year-old son on July 16, 2011. Our room was very clean and modern. We attended the Jays game in the afternoon (the Rogers Centre is a short walk away) and then returned to the hotel for a swim before dinner. The roof-top pool is amazing! My son absolutely loved it. After a nice swim, we went for dinner at Wayne Gretzky's (one block away) and then walked around the theatre district. The location of this hotel is amazing...you can just park your car and walk everywhere. Used the fitness centre and the pool again the next morning. Check out was a breeze. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “U2 in Toronto, and a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: surfer82423
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when we went to see U2 perform at the Rogers Centre, in July 2011. Great concert and a great hotel! Location was a deciding factor, when I chose this hotel. We were within a three block walking distance to the Rogers Centre. While everyone was waiting in traffic after the concert, we were back at the hotel within minutes! Great amenities and right in the center of the action in downtown Toronto. Several nice restaurants right next to hotel. The hotel had a great rooftop pool with a wonderful view of the city. The CN Tower could be easily viewed while relaxing in the pool. My only improvement would be adding mini fridges in the standard king rooms. My partner is diabetic and we had to keep filling ice buckets to keep her insulin cool. So a fridge would have been nice. Other than that, a great stay in a great hotel! We'll definitely stay in this hotel again whenever in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice! Great outdoor pool view!”
Reviews.Author: Gretchen73
Reviews.Content: Our room was a bit on the small side, but I understand that is the norm for Toronto. Although, I was happy that we were given a room with two queens as we had 2 adults with 2 kids. We were on the11th floor. We arrived at 1 and were allowed to check in early. Our room was clean, and non-smoking! The pool was great! My kids loved it! There was some scum along the wall, but I thought it was going to be worse from the previous posts. The pool is heated, and the view amazing of the CN Tower and skyline. They do not have the outdoor bar open during the week which was unfortunate as people were bringing their own beverages and snacks. The pool bathrooms were really clean and updated. The bed was ok. The mattress may need to be rotated as I felt like my feet were higher than my head. My husband commented on this too.

Reviews.Title: “Mother-Daughter bonding!”
Reviews.Author: frankie036
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt on King is located in the middle of the entertainment district. It was a walk to the Theatre and the food around the hotel is unique and fun. Check in was quick. The clerk was kind to give us directions to the places we needed to go. We ordered room service and watched a movie - the food portions were large, service was quick. A bit pricey - but worth it! The room was modern and our first impression was that it was small. But, when we settled in - we realized it had everything we needed - extremely clean, well maintainted, giant tv, internet, great in-room coffee and awesome beds! Came back late after the Lion King - hotel was secure with a bellman at the elevators talking to guests as they went up to their rooms. Quiet night. Easy walk to breakfast and not a far walk to the mall for shopping. Had a great Italian dinner right across the street and then off to Glee! After the show (and a fantastic eco-friendly cab/bike ride back the the hotel), our group had drinks at the hotel lounge. The staff was very accomodating to open an area of the restaurant so my daughter could join us (she's not 19) and we really appreciated their efforts. Quick check out - car service to the airport! Overall, a fabulous weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetant and Poorly Trained Staff”
Reviews.Author: redwinetime
Reviews.Content: I had planned a girls weekend to Toronto and chose the Hyatt Regency based on location, and reputation for quality service. Boy was I wrong about the customer service. My reservations were incorrect when I called to confirm. I spoke to the receptionist was it sounded like they were fixed, however, when I arrived, nothing had been changed. I spent 30 minutes of my trip trying to get the front desk to figure out my reservation. Bottom line, the staff is incompetant. The manager was helpful, eventually, but really this should not have been such a difficulty. Once we finally ironed out our reservations, we went upstairs and waited a half hour until we finally called to see when the luggage would be brought up. The lobby of the hotel is nice. The rooms are small but cute. The pool area was small, but a novelty in downtown Toronto. The bar in the lobby had the best drinks we encountered in Toronto and the location of this hotel is great. However, I will NEVER stay at a Hyatt again based on the staffs' lack of training and inability to make my stay stress free.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Property”
Reviews.Author: JazzyNC
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel, because I found a great deal through AA.com. My friend and I stayed here for a total of 5 nights.
