Our room was a tiny corner unit, and this was definitely not like any Hyatt I have stayed at in the past. Room Comfort The beds were a bit above average. I was able to get a good nights sleep here. The decor is very IKEA which I knew beforehand because I read quite a few reviews. Food For breakfast, we ordered room service twice. The first time the pancakes were AMAZING -- huge, great flavor, and dusted with powdered sugar!! They were probably the best pancakes I have ever eaten in my life. The next day -- apparently a different chef was working in the kitchen --- pancakes just OK and had a different flavor -- and the bacon was a bit overcooked. We did have lunch at the bar twice as well --- it was pretty good both times. I definitely recommend the chicken fingers!!! Yummy!!! Location The hotel is close to many cool little bars and restaurants that offer excellent food. You are within walking distance to the subway -- ask the concierge for a map and directions. Overall our stay here was pleasant, and we met some nice people at the hotel. One of the bartenders at the lobby bar was super nice!! I believe her name was Maria. If you plan on hanging out in your room a lot and you are expecting luxurious accommodations --- this is probably not the hotel for you. We were in town for a festival -- the room met our needs simply because we were out and about exploring Toronto. I would stay here again if I found a really good deal on a room here.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: malatestiano
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations through Hotwire and had a heavily discounted rate...and I could tell... Honestly, if they don't like this kind of rate, they should not offer it... I was given a Room that was definitely clean but not worth a 4 star hotel: worn out furniture and NO mini bar. Staff at reception was not friendly at all both at check in and at check out. On the positive side: great location. Walking distance from many great restaurants and from all the business partners I had to visit during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put, Horrible and acts of Racism took place.”
Reviews.Author: imar9
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hyatt Regency, first I'd like to say that the facilities themselves, rooms, pool, etc. are in great condition and very clean and well put together. However, the managerial staff or of the lowest quality. It was a friends birthday party and we were only in the room to change before we headed out for a night on the town. When we received a series of noise complaints. Which was odd as we did not have any music playing and there were on 6 people in the room. We continuously kept trying to tell the manager that it couldn't have been us and showed him our room. After only our second noise complaint, which again keep in mind, could not have been coming from our room, we were greeted by the police! Astounded I began trying to explain that we had paid for this $300 room and that it wasn't our room making any noise. The officers began to forcefully remove us from the room, not giving us a chance to remove our belongings! We were thrown onto the streets of Toronto with no place to stay and no belongings. Thus ending our night for good, we had to look around the city for hours just to find a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Design at the Cost of Function”
Reviews.Author: vava903
Reviews.Content: This is a tale of two reviews. The hotel staff, the location, the amenities all very good. The rooms...ridiculous. The design of the rooms is so bad, it's laughable. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and this room took the cake. On the good side...the mattresses were comfortable. On the ridiculous side,,,there were NO and I mean zero drawers to put anything. There were 3 1/2 angled drawers built into some funky wall treatment that were big enough for a small cosmetic bag or some underwear. Closet very small with five hangers, although they brought us more when we requested them. Not a flat surface in the entire room to put slacks or shirts or anything. No space in the bathroom for cosmetics, and only one small towel rack and no hooks for clothes or wet towels, nothing. The bed is designed so far away from the wall that you have to use a bolster pillow to reach the wall if you want to sit up in bed. No mirror in the room itself, only a door mirror on the inside closet door. Instead of putting a mirror by the small desk, they have some wooden design treatment. Would have helped to have a mirror there, since the bathroom is too small for putting on your makeup, especially if you are in the room with other people. Lighting awful. Too dim, and if you wanted to leave the bathroom light on for a night light there is a glass panel from the bedroom to the bathroom so it lights up the entire bedroom at night. The designer of these rooms should be publicly flogged. This is not typical Hyatt design, it's bizarre. Not functional at any level. Again, kudos to a very accommodating staff. However, when I got home I had three pending charges for nearly $300 even though I used Hyatt Gold Passport points. They told me some story about charging in advance and then it is taken off your credit card, but it's been three days and I am still waiting for the charges to come off. So keep an eye on your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Partygoers”
Reviews.Author: PT_Duck06
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for this hotel on Expedia for only $135. For that price, the hotel was great. But if we had paid full price, we would have been pretty upset for the following reasons: 1. The lobby and rooms are very modern, but the guestrooms are showing some signs of age (some chips out of furniture, etc). The shower was horrible. There was no way of turning it on to warm up without getting soaked. We couldn't figure out a way to control the temperature in the room, so it was freezing cold or stinking hot. 2. Check-in was very inefficient. 3. The clientele. There are a lot of people who were staying here who were in downtown Toronto to party. As such, the hotel has a policy that each guest must present a room key to a security guard after 10 pm to gain entrance to the elevators. But that doesn't help much. From 4pm until the next morning (~9 am) every time we went into the hallway, we encountered drunk people, including one guy who stumbled out of his doorway to yell after his buddy to buy him some more beer, a second (very buff, very tatooed) guy walking down the hallway with his beer, and a group of girls at a bachelorette party trying to get picked up by a soldier. I never felt unsafe, but it was unpleasant and noisy. 4. The "bartender" in the lobby bar made horrible cocktails. If you normally stay at Hyatts (or equivalent) I think you will be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is good but cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: ALangOntario
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the heart of the entertainment district. Decor was contemporary. Room was in good size as it is in downtown Toronto but the bathroom was too small for its hotel class. Staff were friendly and polite. Room service was prompt and food was delicious. However, dirtiness undercut its merits. There were stains on the bed cover and in the bathroom that definitely ruined the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable quiet room. Good location for Theatres and Rogers Stadium.”
Reviews.Author: johnpaul1
Reviews.Content: Visited Toronto for a combination business trip and baseball game. The Toronto Blue Jays destroyed the New York Yankees. The hotel is a short walk from the stadium and close to restaurants and bars. Had a good breakfast at Dunn's Deli just down the street. The bagel was an authentic Montreal bagel and for those who know, this is worth the walk. The hotel lobby was interesting. The bed was comfortable, the room was quiet and clean, the air conditioning was very efficient and quiet. The room needed some updating. The doors and mirror need to be repaired or replaced.. The roof top pool was very nice and offered a good respite 17 floors above the city with very good views. The hotel staff were very helpful and parking was at the hotel and easily accessible. Compared to other 4 star hotels I have stayed in I would say this one is average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Rooms are overdesigned”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: This former "Holiday Inn of King" has had quite the makeover. Public areas are now very sleek and modern. I stayed 1 night with a Hotwire deal. My room was also very sleek, but impractical. My bathroom was so small that my legs practically rubbed up against the toilet to be at the sink. Lighting was poor. Toilet paper dispenser location is not practical. Limited counter space. They replaced the tub with a shower Bed comforter way too heavy. TV is a tad too low. The red storage bins? Clearly, created for the look - totally useless for storing clothes. The work desk light isn't flexible, it's mounted above. Elevators were always a wait. I liked the large closet, enjoyed the pool area (9am-10pm) with comfy seating. Fitness area (24 hr) is well designed and has expansive views. Equipment with buiit in TVs includes 2 elipticals and 4 treadmills. Changerooms next to the fitness even have a sauna. This property has a great location with a fabulous view of CN Tower. Many restaurant/bar options nearby. Within the hotel is a Starbucks. Subway sandwich shop and Tim Hortons are within 2 blocks. A Shoppers Drug Mart open till midnight is next door. There are numerous hotels nearby offering practical rooms. As such, I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , room too small”
Reviews.Author: drums45
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 15th -17th for a getaway wedding anniversary weekend. I asked for a quiet room, high floor, away from the elevator and that's what we got. 19th floor. I have to say it was the quietest hotel stay we've ever had- NICE! We took an upgraded room with a view and balcony. The balcony was enormous and useless, no chairs or table to sit and enjoy the beautiful cityscape (spectacular at night). I have to agree with other reviews about counter space- there wasn't any. I had to lay my makeup out on the bed and run back and forth to the bathroom. Very poor planning by whoever designed the otherwise nice room. I mean like NO place other than around small sink area (enough for a toothbrush and glass). For that reason I would not stay there again. Liked the location. Pool is small.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: polarbelle
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from a Hyatt. Room decor was admittedly not to my taste with its tired '80s feel. The room was by no means filthy, but was dusty around the headboard and the white chairs were showing all the dirt. Outdoor pool was unfortunately closed due to the weather. Stayed there on business and even with the reduced conference rate I felt it was overpriced. There are much nicer hotels providing better value at this price within blocks of this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: crmercado
Reviews.Content: It was our first time visiting Toronto. We were cordially treated the entire stay. The hotel staff was friendly, attentive and polite. We loved the hotel, specially the location. This hotel would definitely be the hotel of choice in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...great hotel....very snazzy!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rayth
Reviews.Content: Was very surprised to see my room when I arrived at this hotel. It was very stylish and well appointed. Great location if visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: martin03102010
Reviews.Content: The location is generally good although I'd consider "downtown" areas as not the perfect place to stay but at least the CN Tower is close enough as is the financial centre. The hotel is generally ok but nothing special and I've stayed in much nicer and cheaper 3* hotels. There's no minibar, the Ipod dock (which may be nice but I personally didn't care) in my room wasn't working as wasn't the bathtub (for some reason it was leaking). Breakfast was awful. I stayed 6 nights and couldn't have imagined to have the same breakfast each day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Mid-Week Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wunderdawgie
Reviews.Content: Braced ourselves for a hotel struggling to stay in the 4 star category, but was pleasantly surprised by the stay. Check-in was quick and easy with the receptionist quickly accommodating request for a room slightly different from the reservation. The hotel has been upgraded with a George Jetson sensibility - lots of shiny finishes in the room and the lobby, but not to the point of overbearing. Hotel itself looks like a cascading cake from the 80's when Hyatt got their 'B team' firmly behind the drafting table. Nonetheless, the location was excellent (tip: park down the street for a bit less than hotel rate), the service was friendly, the room was quiet, the pool unexceptional, but part of a great overview of the downtown scene in an open lounge area. There's lots of choice in T.O, but you won't be overly disappointed with this hotel as some of the other reviews may suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Poor Room for the Price”
Reviews.Author: patraveler45_11
Reviews.Content: We assumed this property would be similar to other Hyatts we have visited. Wrong, wrong, wrong! The rooms (ours and our friends) were tiny and similar in comfort to what one would expect at a Red Roof. Almost no storage - five itty-bitty drawers and one cubby that were suitable only for socks and underwear. A 24" wide closet. A folding storage rack for a suitcase but not really any place to put it. The bathroom was almost entirely devoid of counter space. The bathroom lighting was awful -couldn't shave by it, much less put on makeup (according to spouse). The room was so small both my spouse and I suffered impact wounds on our legs from knocking into the hard square wood bed frame. No fresh linen service unless one begs for it (a "green" feature -hah!) On-site parking is your typical downtown hotel rip-off to the tune of $29 per night. And wi-fi is $15 per day. No relief in the business center either at $5 per 15 minutes. And don't get me started on the elevators. Most trips we had to wait several minutes regardless of the time of day. Even had to resort to taking an "up" car to be able to get on one going down. It appeared that only three of the four cars were actually operating for much, if not all, of the three day weekend. The pluses - great location, close to the CN Tower, Rogers Centre, and the mini-restaurant row on King. The beds were comfortable, although they were only fitted with sheets and an extra heavy comforter (had to jury-rig something to be comfortable temperature-wise.) The shower worked well, and the staff was pleasant and helpful. All in all, not much value for the money. And the room size precludes staying with a family - it was tight for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room for the price. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: snowBoardBunny
Reviews.Content: They are situated right on King st and there is no parking out front, but the hotel is easy to get to from Union station and it is about 6 minute walk to the subway. The streetcar stops are about 1.5 blocks away. So location is great. I got the hotel via one of the links on travel site aggregator, and I ended up getting the 3rd night for free. The value for quality and amenities was great. I wish I could have eaten at the restaurant, but twice I had to change plans and ended up not eating there at all. The staff are very friendly and efficient upon check-in. I had a corner room, so it was pretty spacious. The decor is modern. There is a Starbucks in the lobby with free wi-fi, so I used that in the mornings and in the evenings, since I was in town for a social visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away for your own good!”
Reviews.Author: phantom_girl00000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the disappointment of a month long holiday in Canada. After staying in 8 hotels prior to this one on the trip it didn't measure up to even the 3 star ones we stayed in during organized tours. This is not a hyatt, after staying at the hyatt in Calgary this was a significant disappointment. I am so glad we obtained a good deal to stay here because paying full price for this place would be depressing! Upon checking in for a 6 day stay we were advised that we had a king bed, that would have been lovely if we hadn't booked for 3 people. The arrogant person at the check in advised us as we hadn't gone through the hotel to book the room that securing 2 beds for 3 people is only something they can consider not ensure. Excuse me? We weren't asking for a better view, 3 people cannot sleep in one bed. We showed our booking info confirming we booked a triple room, this made no difference. The rude staff member advised us the hotel was booked out, amazingly enough after looking on his computer for no more than 10 seconds he found us an available room, amazing huh? 'insert sarcasm here'. From that moment it was downhill, maids removed our privacy sign and knocked on the door one morning just so she could get the room cleaned, we told her no. The privacy sign was never seem from again. They charge you $25 a night for parking, $14.95 for Internet use and even then the access code is for one device only at a time. This was the only hotel out of the 9 we stayed at where Internet wasn't included. In today's world you get Internet in shopping centers, restaurants so why not is it included when you are paying to stay here??? I will never stay at this hotel again, nor will I advise anyone I know to stay here. They are rude and arrogant. By the way, if you want free wireless go down to the Starbucks in the lobby, stand outside the entrance and use theirs. Highlight of the hotel is the Starbucks. Internet access is sometimes vital when you are from another country. I am sure I won't even get one of those personal comments from the hotel on my review (now I might because I complained I wouldn't). Because as I look through these reviews they only comment back on good experiences. Way to go for customer service, gold star for you.

Reviews.Title: “King suite for family of three (adults) a winner.”
Reviews.Author: cyberlion
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were advised by reception that the booked queen room size was too small in their opinion for us being a family of 3 adults so they suggested an upgrade to a king suite. Naturally this costs more but the hotel gave us a discount to encourage us to upgrade which we did. This for me counts as great service and made our three night stay very enjoyable hence our preference for the Hyatt chain where possible. All round the hotel is well located, ample working lifts, good bar downstairs and the king suite was terrific - large, quiet and had a view looking to the tower from 19th floor. We did a day trip to Niagara Falls from Toronto by car and had lunch in a vineyard - this was a very full day, enjoyable but more tiring than anticipated especially as we had "lost" 3 hours having flown in from Vancouver the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt should be ashamed”
Reviews.Author: Animal70
Reviews.Content: This is not a Hyatt Regency hotel, it's a Holiday Inn that's been dressed up. Location is indeed convenient, and the decor is modern, spacious and tasteful. Room service is good. I stayed here over a weekend however, and I thought I was back in a university dorm room. There were loud parties going on in several rooms on my floor until the wee hours of the morning. I asked the front desk to look into it, but they said they were under-manned and had to tend to "issues going on in the lobby". I ultimately had to change rooms with no help from the staff whatsoever. It took me 30 minutes to arrange this at 3am. When I got to my new room, I encountered more rowdiness, this time from very loud guests in the halls returning to their rooms at 4am. I booked the room on the Internet and got a very good rate, so perhaps I got what I deserved. I was surprised when I saw a Hyatt Regency at the same price point as many other "lesser" hotel brands in the area. Now I know why. Overall, I was disappointed that Hyatt would risk tarnishing its brand by having this hotel (managed as it is) in the portfolio.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Toronto's entertainment district.”
Reviews.Author: Point30
Reviews.Content: Checkin was very good- professional, and fast. Some small issues: The sheets did not seem to fit the bed very well and slipped off throughout the night. No readily available newspaper for pick up at the front desk (or on the door) normally available from other hotels at this pricepoint. On the site we received the deal from we did not know about the seasonal pool. Perhaps a little overpriced (considering that they added another $25 for parking on top of the deal we received).

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Modern Decor and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Doctorsarah_11
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the Hyatt Regency Toronto. We simply loved the great service from the front desk and bell staff! They went the extra mile and had good suggestions for trendy new eats. The decor is sleek and modern very trendy! The location is great for the summer time as we like to walk to our appointments and meetings in the sunshine! Close to the Fininacal district and right in the Entertainment district. Tip* I would sugest to get the best deal to call the hotel direct.

Reviews.Title: “Good. But we had to chage our room.”
Reviews.Author: Monica_from_Brazil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. There's a parking place to the gests, restaurants, and a frendly staff. It's near the CN tower and the Rogers stadium. Also near the theaters and restaurants. But at first, when we did the check in, late at night, we got a room in a low floor with no view. That's ok, we didn't mind, just got a little frustrated. But in the morning we realized that there was watter all over the bathroom floor and the sink faucet was loudly noise when we tried to turn it on. We've asked to chage to another room. And, althought the very good treatment we had from the front desk, we got another room with problems. It was dirty, the bathroom door didn't lock and the exhaust fan in the bathroom did not work. Again, I've talked to the front desk staff, and got I really good surprise when we came back from our day activities and was replaced to a very comfortable suite, with nice view and a lovely appologise card from de front desk manager. At the end, we were really glad with our stay. Hope they could give the same treatment from the begening.

Reviews.Title: “Less than fancy.”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMama4
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency in Toronto, despite being in a fantastic location is somewhat lackluster compared to other hotels in the downtown core. Service was fine, but not fantastic. Hotel restaurant and bar should be skipped in favour of much better within easy walking distance. Decor was tired somehow even though it looked like it was recently upgraded. I used priceline to get three nights at $75 and I'm glad I didn't pay more. Made up for the $25/night parking fee. No tub. No spa. Don't order the Starbucks coffee to your room. Go downstairs and get it for half the price. It's in the lobby and frankly, it's the highlight of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Design”
Reviews.Author: ppags
Reviews.Content: We went to Toronto for 2 Red Sox games and chose this hotel because it was close to the Roberts Center. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The issue were the rooms, they lacked I hesitate to say amenities because they are missing basics. There was no real bureau, instead they had 4 1' by 1' cubes, there was no soap dish, grab bar or even no hook behind the door in the bathroom. There was no place to put your shaving kit pr anything else. The room was nice looking with a large flat screen TV but looks like it was designed to feed someones ego rather than to be a functioning hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, though lacking some functionality”
Reviews.Author: leenNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Entertainment District, and there are lots of restaurants and bars nearby. The lobby/bar area of the hotel is very busy, trendy and was a great spot for a drink. The room was very modern, though it did lack some functionality. There was no mirror aside from in the bathroom (and a small mirror/shelf high above the bed). The bathroom was small and lacked space for hanging up towels. There was also no fan in the bathroom, which is annoying after you shower, especially since there wasn't another mirror in the main part of the room. There was also a frosted glass window in the bathroom that faced the beds, which is a bit strange for a room with two double beds. Also, the room had a large flat screen tv with no HD channels. There is a rooftop pool and patio area, unfortunately it wasn't warm enough to use while I was there! It was a good hotel for a night, and I would stay here again. I wouldn't want to stay in the room for a week due to the size of the bathroom and lack of storage space. We got a great deal on the room through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “We just loved it!! and have also planned our next stay there!”
Reviews.Author: arreddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hyatt Regency toronto for a couple of nights in April! and we just loved it. Skeptical initially by the not so good ratings, we were totally taken by surprise as our stay turned out to be really wonderful. The room we were given was awesome with nice view of CN tower. Location is very perfect on King Street in downtown toronto and public transport at arms reach.This hotel is steps aways from CN tower, Rogers Center and other downtown attractions.If you are looking for night life in downtown toronto, you wont find a better hotel. The full breakfast was on par with some of the best hotels in North America. Sandeep at the front desk was a great guy and very helpful. Nice fitness center but swimming pool was closed. Parking is expensive ( I think around $24) but you can find a number of cheaper options for parking around.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: WordDiva
Reviews.Content: Great location with excellent customer service. I choose this hotel from other tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed. If possible, reserve a package that includes the full breakfast buffet, it is delicious. I was expecting your typical, boring continental breakfast and was pleasantly surprised to see "real" food. Friendly, accommodating staff and clean rooms give it two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully perfect stay...”
Reviews.Author: Joshdent
Reviews.Content: After checking out the TripAdvisor reviews of this hotel days before my family and I were departing for a Toronto vacation, I was terribly worried after reading lots of negative feedback. My family's experience could not have been more different. We had a terrific stay and the hotel staff went out of their way to make us comfortable. The positive experience started when we checked in after our international flight arrived in the morning and we appeared at the hotel at 9:30 am. Not only were we given a room (!) but it was a non-smoking, king bed, with a great view of the CN Tower which we wanted (thanks for setting us up Felicita!). The room was nicely sized and was decorated in a modern/trendy style. The bathroom is small and did not have a tub. The only complaint I had was that I agree with other reviewers there is very little storage space in the hotel room- there is ample closet space, but very few drawers and the ones there are are small and oddly shaped. That was more than offset by the location in the Entertainment District- centrally located to the CN Tower, the Islands, Chinatown and Kensington Market. While not right on the subway, the hotel is on a streetcar and a short 2 block walk to the subway. The service was outstanding. In addition to Felicita at the front desk, Dusty at the front desk let me walk behind the counter and use her own computer to print out my boarding pass when the kiosk to do it wasn't working, and Wesen on the valet staff gave my toddler son some toy balls as a gift when he was crying in the lobby. Our stay could not have been more pleasant and contributed to a terrific Toronto vacation. I would stay at this hotel again next time I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and up-to date.”
Reviews.Author: Goose54
Reviews.Content: Last year I stayed at the Marriott on Yonge Street and was not happy. This Hyatt is the complete opposite. Terrific location, very modern clean and up-to-date. In walking distance to baseball, hockey stadiums and convention center. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service & housekeeping steals!! Watch out!!”
Reviews.Author: laurenm13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night as we were in town for a concert. The room was modern in decor and the bed was large and comfortable. We had a nice view of the CN tower and the hotel in general is very nice. Parking is a rip off for $25...the tv channels were fuzzy but there was an ipod dock in the room which was a nice touch. Overall our stay was pleasant UNTIL the very end. As we were leaving our room and heading towards the elevator (on the way to check out), I dropped my wallet and coins went everywhere. A housekeeping staff that was in the hallway "helped" me pick the money, only for me to see her slip a toonie in her pocket. I didn't want to make a big deal out of it, especially since I assumed she would be cleaning our room so I didn't say anything. A few hours after we left the hotel I realized that I left both my watch and diamond necklace in the hotel...I phoned right away and was transferred to "lost and found"...I would hope that if my diamond necklace was found that it would be locked up and not put in a "lost and found" bin....anyways after I finally got to talk to someone he told me he would check to see if anything had been turned in...I was on hold for MAYBE 30 seconds and then I was told nothing was turned in. I asked him to check the room and he said that wasn't possible. I have phoned back everyday since our stay making sure nothing has shown up and last time I was told "not to call back and if they find anything that they will call ME"....how rude! This is not only an expensive necklace, but a sentimental one....either housekeeping found my valuables and kept them (I hate to draw that conclusion but considering she pocketed my money when I dropped it, it doesn't seem that far off) or the guests after me kept it....either way the Hyatt was LESS that accomodating to try and help me out.....never again...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: schnugchi
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay in the king bed guest room was pleasant. The staff were friendly and accommodating, the rooms were clean and modern looking. Early spring is a good time to travel and for the price we paid, it exceeded our expectations. It is located in the slightly west downtown area of Toronto; a hop, skip and a jump to anywhere you'd like to be. Subway lines and streetcars make it effortless to venture further away from the core. One slight improvement would be to provide free WIFI, a necessary standard for the modern traveller.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a Hyatt the way you think it is”
Reviews.Author: Calgaryprisoner
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's got Hyatt in the name ...that's good. The downside is complete indifference about what happens to you after 11:00 and the night staff start despising you for even existing. BEWARE. We thought we were going crazy and went to the other Hyatt at Avenue and Bloor ...THAT was a REAL Hyatt. so... just don't get suckered in by the name. We did some quick research and it turns out the Regency was a Holiday Inn converted into a Hyatt ...which explains the rooms. I feel weird about writing this review. I like Hyatts. But the abandonment of guests after 11:00 is hotel suicide. Guys, get your act together. Don't hand people apizza flyer with a hostile voice and expect them to ever come back. PS: Douchey nightclub music in the lobby. Klassy!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more from Hyatt, would recommend elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: AquariusShark
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my expectations of a Hyatt were too high, but I didn't anticipate the quality of stay and calibre of service I received. I don't know enough about the Hyatt chain to appreciate whether the "Regency" line of hotels are there more budget... but regardless the summary of my experiences below do not reflect well on Hyatt or any 3 star + hotel. 1. Upon arrival I parked my vehicle on P2 and proceeded to walk toward the elevator. Someone who looked to be wearing an Engineering uniform exited from a non-labeled door and exited the area where one waits for the elevator. This staff person did not smile, did not hold the door for me or engage with me in any way. As a result, my suitcase became stuck as the door shut making a very awkward first impression. 2. The Front Desk seemed generally understaffed. I called to register my vehicle after using the kiosk check-in and was transferred by the operator to the F/D only to be put on hold for quite some time. I called back, explained to the Operator I had been placed on hold for several minutes. While he did take my plate and said he would register it, there was no apology or sense of urgency from the gentleman for me having been put on hold for some time. 3. I was initially checked into 1536. Decently sized room, modern in decor (identical to other photos posted here). Much to my surprise, I came across spots of urine on the toilet seat. When I called down, Sheena at the desk was quite polite and offered another room, but informed me that the Concierge was going to busy with another guest, so they wouldn't be able to come up and help me for 5 minutes or so, and suggested that I could either wait, or come down myself. Not really wanting to wait around in a dirty room, and since I had stuff I wanted to get to, I opted to go down myself. When I got down, I spoke with a Jose who appeared to be a manager (this was after a wait at the Desk of 2 or 3 mins. as all agents were busy - speaking to point #2). A bellman did approach me while waiting to make small talk which was a nice touch. Once speaking with Jose, he apologized and offered to upgrade me for the inconvenience to one of their "view rooms" overlooking the CN Tower and I was given 1912. I am not sure if Jose just didn't pick his words carefully or is newer and doesn't know his product well, both my original room 1536 and new room 1912 have views of the CN Tower, and while 1912 is a better view of the two, I wouldn't necessarily sell somoene of the CN Tower view when moving them from somewhere else that has a similar feature... especially as a means of compensation for a negative experience. 4. I called for Turndown Service when I went to the gym. I returned to the room to find the bed turned down nicely and the radio on, drapes drawn. But I had taken a shower on arrival and was surprised to see that the washroom had not been touched. The wet towels were still in the tub and no new towels had been given. Turndown service is normally considered a second, light, evening service... and while I wouldn't expect a full re-cleaning, I was surprised that the attendant didn't at least remove the old towels and provide a set of new ones. 5. The toilet doesn't flush properly. You need to hold down the flusher/handle until the bowl fills with water sufficiently for it to flush, you can't just push the handle and walk away. This is a very easy fix by a Maintenance person if reported (I will be mentioning it at check-out for the sake of the next guest). 6. Called for Room Service in the morning and ordered the Eggs Benedict and an Apple/Soy Shake. Food was good, but the shake is advertised with a Biscotti which never arrived... not a big issue, but worth mentioning in light of everything else. All in all my stay has been disappointing. Granted I got in on a very good rate, it doesn't leave me with a positive impression of Hyatt, which I had always regarded as being a very well run, service oriented organization. The only time during my stay and my MANY encounters with staff either at the desk, in the bar or over the telephone where my name was used was with the Room Service person, otherwise zero name recognition. Luckily I am a heavy sleeper, but as I sit at the desk in the room and write this review, I can clearly hear every word of the conversation of the gentleman next door. Perhaps its because I am sitting near the window where soundproofing is probably more challenging, but this might be a potential issue for any light sleepers. Truthfully I didn't notice this during the course of the night. I went down to the bar for a beer and to watch the hockey game. The hotel's proximity to the Entertainment District and probably many clubs meant there were young men and women coming in and out the entire evening (around 10-11pm) and were highly intoxicated. Not that this is the hotel's fault, and I understand they can't control the activities of guests in their room, a word to the wise that they too could be a noise problem. One woman, who could barely walk and must have been 19 if that, propositioned me as she walked out the elevators with her friends on their way to a club no doubt, granted she was joking. Regardless, the pricepoint and location of this hotel might make it attractive to the young party crowd. With so many accommodation options in Toronto, I just don't think Hyatt Regency makes the grade. I would urge others to stay elsewhere if looking for a truly indulgent stay. This hotel seems to have poor attention to detail, poor cleanliness standards and all-in-all has not impressed me. Especially disappointed with the washroom issue, that is just unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY! Fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: cdnhart
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this great hotel. Fast check-in and the staff were amazingly friendly. Great ammenities, convenient location and modern looking rooms. Room 1455 has a nice view down King Street and of the CN but 1804 was a corner room that when you slept you could view the tower unobstructed. Gabby's bar across the street is a great local place and the Adelaide Street pub around the corner had some great beers on tap. Didn't love the fact that "unsecured" underground parking was $25 per day and that internet was not included. Spent time at the downstairs Starbucks for free internet instead.

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel remodeled”
Reviews.Author: ctron1
Reviews.Content: This is clearly an old hotel which has recently been given a facelift. The rooms are small, but nice. They have clearly stripped the old rooms and put in "modern" looking fixtures and fittings. This leads to some challenges! You have to crawl under a huge headboard to reach bedside plugs! Also there is very little drawer space. Also as nearly every review says that have remodeled the bathrooms in a very odd way! They have put in frosted glass in the dry wall. Consequently you can see what is happening in the bathroom! That was fine since I was sharing a room with my wife! Parking is in an unsecure garage under the hotel. We had no problems but I can see why others did. On the positive side the staff are very friendly and we were offered a two o'clock check out, which was great! Also this hotel is consistently the cheapest four star in downtown south, when bidding on priceline. All in all if you want four star service and a happy to put up with rooms which are smaller than the usual four star, then this hotel is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Louisbean
Reviews.Content: Quiet rooms, location is great, quick check in/out using self service kiosks at front desk. Internet is expensive at $14.95 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Fix the wallpaper”
Reviews.Author: kslg
Reviews.Content: Place was just okay. Room had a horrible view and the wallpaper was peeling off the walls. Internet pricey...$15 a day! No mini bar!!! Good location. Lobby nice.

Reviews.Title: “One thing can ruin the stay”
Reviews.Author: SDFlipFlops
Reviews.Content: Being a Platinum member of Hyatt I've stayed at my fair share. This hotel is beautiful and in a great location to walk to food and things to do. We were upgraded to a wonderful suite. Every time we went in or out Ray ( front desk personal) would speak to us directly, giving us valuable information, he also had a complimentary dessert delivered to our room on my birthday. Unfortunately he was not on duty when we checked out. We had to return to the desk twice.

Reviews.Title: “We were Robbed! Don't park in the Hyatt garage!!”
Reviews.Author: HamishWilliams
Reviews.Content: So the start of our new year was to be robbed. Frankly it was partly our fault. We were loaded down with Xmas presents and we thought because we were paying for parking and it was the Hyatt Regency, that some of our belongings would be safe in the car. WRONG! Little did we know, the hotel parking is combined with public. There is no guard at the booth and security is extremely lax. The cameras are few and inadequate. Why not have cameras in the stair wells???? It was clear that were hit by an expert that knows the weaknesses of the parking garage. The Hyatt did comp our room and give us breakfast. Thanks! Until this is fixed this is just a 2nd rate hotel. Don't stay here until they fix the security or at least tell EVERYONE who parks there that break-ins are a regular thing. The police reaction was dismal. The thief even made multiple phone calls using the stolen phone and the police couldn't catch the guy. Not sure they even tried. Also, we searched the internet and found at least 5 break-ins at this hotel in the past 4 months. Shame on you Hyatt Regency Toronto!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, and good value”
Reviews.Author: gpdLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a mining conference when the town was jammed. The staff were very efficient helpful and friendly - I needed halp with a couple of logistical things and they came up trumps, so I was v happy. It isn't particularly beautiful but the beds are comfortable and location is excellent. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globe07
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Location was very good. Nice hotel, has starbucks in its premises. Staff is quite helpful. Rooms were comfortable. Definetly would recommend to friends. Will stay again for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: australaura
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a mini get-away to celebrate Valentine's day. I booked last-minute with a fantastic "name your price" deal on Priceline. When we checked in, the woman at the front desk was extremely friendly and pleasant. Contrary to previous reviewers, we did not have bad service or attitude because of our Priceline rate. Also, we did not have any problems with the speed of the elevators. Our room was on the 17th floor facing the CN Tower - lovely! It had very modern decor, with an extremely large TV and comfortable King size bed. I agree with other reviewers who had problems if you are staying longer - there is NO dresser and so there are very few places to unpack your clothes. The part I liked the least was probably the bathroom - it is tiny, it has a SLIDING door (strange), and there is frosted glass facing the rest of the room, which is private, but might not be comfortable for some. Also, though there is a very large shower stall, there is no bathtub, if that's important to you. The shower was great - very roomy, great water pressure and plenty of hot water. On the morning of our check-out, we called to request a late check-out and had no problems getting bumped back to 1pm. Again, the service was all very friendly. We had the privacy sign on the door and had no interruptions from housekeeping. All-in-all, a very pleasant experience for a great deal. The location is great - not only is it next to the entertainment district, but right across the street are many bars and restaurants great for a meal or just a drink.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Experience Of My Life!”
Reviews.Author: globaltraveller58
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent-flyer who has stayed in all sorts of hotels all over the world. The Hyatt Regency Toronto lost my luggage - and REFUSED to talk to me about it! My luggage was in the care of the concierge when it went missing - for the first time in thirty years of travel. But WORST of all, the hotel's General Manager REFUSED to speak with me or come near me - he even hurriedly turned away when he saw me in the lobby. The loss of my precious hand-luggage was the most frightening, devastating experience of my entire travelling career, but it has been made worse by the bizarre and arrogant actions of the hotel's General Manger who refused to have anything to do with me during my three days stay there. A victim of this hotel's negligence and incompetence, I was further made to feel like a pariah or criminal instead. Now, five months later, I am still fighting for adequate compensation. Absolutely no effort at goodwill, PR or courtesy.....go figure. Be warned, travelers!

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: jojoManchster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year but it still sticks in my mind as a great hotel so thought I must write a review. The hotel location was great, roof terrace was brilliant....great way to relax after a morning of discovering Toronto. Room was great especially the super comfortable bed!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Hyatt Managed Property...”
Reviews.Author: gcs0220
Reviews.Content: This is a Hyatt managed property, so it is not a main line Hyatt. As such, it has some aspects that travelers who routinely stay at a Hyatt may not be familiar with. On the plus side, the food at this Hyatt is fantastic. There is a small menu that ranges from nachos and burgers to refined dishes such as Tom Yum soup or lamb. Presentation is top notch, portions are a good size, and prices are in line with the area. The fitness area is located on the 17th floor. We were told it had been renovated recently and the equipment was very good by hotel standards. There is an outdoor pool which is closed over the winter months. Staff at this property were very helpful. The front desk, room cleaners, and food servers were all friendly. Were the staff not so responsive to our needs, this review would not have been as positive as it is. On the down side, this property physically does not measure up to a main line Hyatt. The rooms are small by Hyatt standards and the modern decor does not make the room more comfortable (it limits storage, lighting, and flex space). The room we stayed in needed to be cleaned as the carpet still had a lot of dirt sitting on it. The sheets were frayed, and the mattress was so soft my wife and I rolled towards the sagging middle as we slept. The washroom also displayed indicators of lax preventative maintenance as the tub caulking was showing mold as was the tile grout. We stayed at this hotel for a week and only one of our nights were disturbed by noise form other guests. The majority of our stay was quiet and uneventful, which is what I expect. Nearby spots to visit include TIFF (next door) as well as a variety of restaurants along the street. Overall our stay was quite good and this is a good hotel. I don't think the average traveler would be disappointed by choosing the Hyatt Regency Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific place to stay in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: GrayingAdventurer
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Hyatt Regency during a 2 night stay in January 2011. The hotel staff was very eager to please, the room was nicely appointed, the bed was terrific. If you like to eat, the location is wonderful. Queen Street is just a few short blocks north and has a huge variety of restaurants. There are many on King Street as well (where the hotel is located). The hotel is just down the street from theatres, the CN Tower, the financial district and much else. The hotel has a summer pool but no winter pool. And no winter hot tub either. There was a sauna and a decent workout room -- lots for us, but some might miss the pool and hot tub. This hotel is like most I have stayed at in that the saunas are in the washrooms and hence "his" and "hers." I never quite understand this set-up. Most people travel with their spouse, and (if they are like me) would like to enjoy a sauna with their spouse. Why not put the sauna in a communal area? Again, this isn't really a criticism, since so many hotels follow the same pattern! The desk clerk knew my name when I came down for my complimentary paper in the morning, and I enjoyed the paper in the very elegant sitting area adjacent to the check-in. Had I wanted coffee, there was a Starbucks just down the hall. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, acceptable, satisfactory, etc.”
Reviews.Author: jfdb
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine. "Mod" design will be quickly outdated, and the finishing work from the renos is a bit sloppy. But check-in was fast, friendly. Very good equipment in the gym, which was empty at 7am on a Thu morning. No complaints, given the price I paid on Hotwire (CAD 120ish). Saw others paid less on Priceline. I wouldn't pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Ballagher
Reviews.Content: Great experience from the time I arrived to the time I left. Staff were terrific, room was clean and modern, flat screen tv, etc. Only complaint would be the gift shop could have been open later at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great public areas, ok room”
Reviews.Author: likesabitofluxury
Reviews.Content: Booked a room last minute on Priceline for cheap so I wouldn't say I got a bad deal, but if I'd paid the going rate ($160 plus) I definitely would have complaints. The chair and counter-tops in the room were a bit stained and scratched--nothing horrible, just showing age and not inviting to a finicky type like me. There was a red, sticky stain on the night table--I think it was nail polish. I wonder if they give lesser rooms to Priceline customers since they don't pay so much... Otherwise, the room was small but cute and modern. Liked the bathroom a lot! Public areas were really cool looking. Starbucks in the lobby was wonderful and there's a drug store and other coffee shops within a block. Lots of nice places to eat across the street and theaters and stuff within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what we wanted but.....”
Reviews.Author: yadayaba
Reviews.Content: We were in town to go to the ROM. We booked on pricline ($85 + Tax) and as a firm believer in you pay for what you get i knew we would not be getting the best room they had. I called the night before to see if we could get a room with two beds as the booking was actually for a one bed room. They said they would see what they could do. When i arrived i was told the booking was for a two queen bed room. The desk staff where absolutely wonderful and lovely The public spaces where immaculate and quite impressive design lead spaces the bar in the basement was very clean tidy and welcoming. Sadly the room wasn't quite what i would expect of the Hyatt regency. One the plus side they had a brilliant TV/PC hook up on the work desk that allows you to connect the TV to computer / camera and the beds where very comfy. One the downside we found used makeup wipes on the shelf above the bed and it was not possible to turn off the extractor fan in the bathroom and it made a horrible droning noise the entire time we where there. As we where only there for one night and the room was dirt cheap these where fairly minor grumbles But if I'd have been in the room 3 or more nights i would have asked to move rooms to get a way from the fan. All in all not a bad place but not quite up to my expectation. I'd recommend it to someone for $90 a night but not more

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBridge
Reviews.Content: We had a week here in December, booking through Wotif. The tariff was excellent - Cad 127 with one free night - must have been December rates. The hotel was comfortable, clean and spacious - we were very happy with it. We did not have breakfast, but there were a couple of excellent offerings down the road to the left - Cafe Uno with friendly staff, and Dunns. There is also a Starbucks in the hotel itself if that fulfills your breakfast needs. Location was good - a short walk to the path (underground city access), toToronto Tower, and to chinatown. We enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Barginhotel
Reviews.Content: We had two differernt reservatio. One through se Toronto now and pricline. Hotel linked them together for us. Excelent service at front desk. All staff very polite. Would recommend and stay again. Dec 28-30

Reviews.Title: “Trendy modern rooms at expense of functionality”
Reviews.Author: communicator1598
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for Toronto's theatres. The Princess of Wales Theatre, the Royal Alexander Theatre and Roy Thompson Hall are all within a 5 minute walk, and this is why we selected it. A bonus is a block of small, good restaurants between the hotel and the theatres. The room was recently modernized and was very trendy and featured: a large flat screen tv built into a curved wall with wood veneer, accented with red and white painted wood; a comfortable king bed, with a built-in headboard which matched the tv unit; a modern walk-in double shower with glass doors (no tub), a vessel-bowl sink, and a frosted glass wall to let in light from the bedroom. Very favourable first impression. The down side of this modernization is that the room lost functionality. The closet space was taken up by the ironing board, in-room safe and folding luggage rack. Apart from leaving a suitcase on a folding rack, there were only small cube boxes in the tv wall unit where one could put small personal items. So suitcases stayed out in the room, holding clothes. The pocket door to the bathroom would not stay open, had no noise-reducing rubber or felt so it banged shut every time someone used the bathroom. The glass wall meant the towel rack was missing in the bathroom -- the one small hook could hold but one towel or two face cloths. The glass wall did admit daylight to the bathroom; but if someone used it in the night, turning on the light in the bathroom flooded the bed with light, waking up whoever was sleeping. The hotel was quiet, the room was clean, the bed was fine and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: crew347
Reviews.Content: Ha ha, this place is a farce. It used to be the Holiday Inn on King and let me tell you - this is not even a proper Holiday Inn. This property is poorly maintained, the staff is not professional, the rooms are dirty, the breakfast restaurant is bad. For the same price, you have much better options in Toronto. Last time I stayed there, I got checked-in an occupied room, followed by a very dirty suite - sticky bathroom, fingerprints everywhere (windows, walls, furniture,), greasy telephone, stained carpet, crusty remote control, noisy air conditioning. The public areas are not better: two out of four elevators are U/S, for a whole evening (i.e. 5-6 hours) there was a full Starbuck cafe latte with whipped cream spilled in the middle of the lobby, sticky everywhere. The basement breakfast restaurant is equally unclean, sticky booths that are reminiscent of a dirty Denny's. Disgusting buffet: cold eggs, dry pastries...beurk, terrible service...

Reviews.Title: “Good location and Quality”
Reviews.Author: flyguy35
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here while on business. This hotel was a conversion from a Holiday Day Inn I believe. It is most definitely not a Holiday Inn now. This hotel is very modern and is beftting the Hyatt name plate. The beds were very comfortable and bedding super nice. The bathroom is well appointed and modern. I was suprised to read in some of the reviews that this hotel had bed bugs, but I have heard about this problem in other high end hotels in the Toronto area. My room was very clean and the room attendants did an excellent job in cleaning my room each day. Internet access is on par with other hotels a 14.95 a day and the speed was very fast, though my Apple lap did have a little issue with connecting the first day. I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern rooms, but an update in customer service is in dire need.”
Reviews.Author: researchnerd
Reviews.Content: Living in the suburbs of Toronto, when a friends birthday comes up I often book a room in the city to spend the night. I stayed at the Hyatt Regency with 1 friend in October 2010, we got a great deal on a room via Priceline and were excited to stay there. The hotel is situated right on King St. in the entertainment district, within walking distance to the great theaters, restaurants and nightlife that Toronto has to offer. The hotel is very beautiful and modern, with sleek television displays and very contemporary designed, although small-in-size rooms. The problems began at check-in. Upon going over my reservation the snooty receptionist noticed that the room had been booked on Priceline, and after muttering "Priceline, of course" under his breath told me that I was not able to request a room with 2 double beds instead of 1 king since they were â€œso busyâ€�, but for an additional $75 charge they could upgrade me to a room with double beds. I remembered looking on the hotelâ€™s website before arrival and seeing that the price of room with either 2 doubles or 1 king is identical. I let it slide and my friend and I stuck with the 1 king bed. I then enquired about underground parking and was told there were no in-and-out privileges, so that every time we left we would have to pay another $24 to get back in?? This did not make sense at all, so I went down to the parking docks and talked to attendant down there who accurately told me that the pass was good for the entire 24 hours and I could come and go as pleased. Other than the rudeness of the front desk clerk and the fact that we were placed on the so called â€œPriceline party floorâ€� (where the hotel thinks it is ok to allow noise and music blast until 4:30am, even with me calling down from our room 3 times and was told that the noise problem would be resolved), my stay at the Hyatt Regency was average. Though if I was the manager I would definitely have a talk with my staff, there are right and wrong ways to deal with guests (even ones that reserve via an discount online travel broker), and I was definitely treated the wrong way!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs !”
Reviews.Author: Ottawan_10
Reviews.Content: I was bitten by bedbugs 3 nights in a row, finally management moved me to a different room and said they would call in a pest control company to investigate. Knowing that they could only be found by trained dogs, i checked on the room while it was being checked. Found out the hotel did not ask them to bring a dog (the only sure way to know), so they only vaccumed and sprayed the room but could not tell for sure what bugs bit me. But the front desk claimed that the company told them there were no bed bugs. They also said that they had never had any. I asked for my clothes to be cleaned before i left and they refused. Another problem was the internet in the room. On their website it is falsely advertised as being free (shown next to things that the hotel provides for free such as "desk"), but once i got there found out it is $15/day. On top of that their Business Centre charges huge prices for for the use of their computer and printer. Although the location is good, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs and Abismal Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lecresanad
Reviews.Content: Less then an hour after getting into bed, I rolled over to place my book on the nightstand and and was face to face with a bed bug. I jumped out of bed and called my coworker and he saw them as well. There were at least two out on the bedding. Lisa from the desk and an unnamed security person (he refused to give his name or position) were very rude and kept reporting that they could not confirm or deny this and they would not give us back our money. They offered another room, but at that point there was no trust that the next room or service would be an improvement. They claimed that no one had reported bed bugs in their hotel but reviews on this site confirm otherwise. This is absolutely the worst hotel either I or my coworker (spends 30% of the year traveling) have ever stayed at. This includes a run-down motel in Mississippi where I was afraid to open the door due to police raids in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JuliaLJ
Reviews.Content: No complaints! Great Room, Very clean! Friendly front desk staff! There was a large party in the room beside ours and security quickly shut it down with no incident! Would recommend this hotel if you are looking to sight see or just a night out on the town! Walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Fast service”
Reviews.Author: rossllen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in part of a surprise birthday celebration. Fast and friendly check in. Parking garage is handy and is big enough for larger vehicles. Room was clean on the most part; except there was dust on the headboard and a greasy forehead mark on the window over-looking the city. Great view by the way! We did have a mishap though... we were running late for our broadway show and our door did not lock... Instant panic!! We rang down to front desk and within minutes the maintenance person arrived. The door did eventually lock and we did exchange our "keys" at the front desk. Thank you Hyatt for your quick response! Decor is trendy and shic, comfy & clean bed (we did check for bed bugs and all was very clean), Stand up shower with average toiletries; towels tucked away nicely under the sink. The elevators were fast and clean; no issues. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Isma1980
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, pleasant stay. Friendly staff. Good restaurants across the street.

Reviews.Title: “AWWESOMNESS”
Reviews.Author: hatecuba_101
Reviews.Content: for those who say this hotel isnt up to par where the heck do you stay this hotel is fantastic super clean modern style comfortable bed amazing cn tower view i pod dock big flatscreen excellent hotel staff everything you could need be there what more can you want

Reviews.Title: “Don't think you're getting the Hyatt experience”
Reviews.Author: smcgolrick
Reviews.Content: the only thing i have to say about this hotel, is that i was expecting sooo much more. with the Hyatt names comes a certain standard, and this hotel did not have that! I believe this hotel was previously a Holiday Inn or something along those lines, and believe me when i say, it maintains all of that - from service to layout and room amenities. the staff looked sloppy, not what i'm used at a Hyatt. Don't get me wrong, I'm not a pretentious traveller, but when i go to a Hyatt, I expect a certain standard and this hotel just didn't have that. The staff were pleasant, but i could have been waiting at the desk for up to 5min before someone asked if they could help me. When i asked for a wine glass at 1am (yes, i know it's late, but they have a 24hr reception) they said, there was no one there to help me. I just found that very average. Ok, so no free wireless...$40 for 24hrs, that's a joke, but that's not uncommon at the Hyatt, they usually rip you off for that sort of stuff. But there wasn't free WiFi anywhere. I just finished a review for the Delta Chelsea HOtel in Toronto and even they could provide free wireless in the lobby. The room didn't even have a minibar! That just doesn't seem right. Ice machines were around the corner, so that was handy. But without a minibar, even if we brought back a bottle of wine, we had no wine glasses. The bathroom was pokey, another feature not common with a Hyatt. There was no space and shower in the bathtub was not adjustable, it was cheaply upgraded. The breakfast is expensive and was average. Nothing was AWFUL with this hotel, i'm just letting everyone know if you're looking for a Hyatt, this isn't the one to go to. Or expect that it's not at a Hyatt calibre. However, it's cheaper than other Hyatt's I've stayed at, so maybe i should have been on notice. I would recommend the Delta Chelsea instead, it was cheaper and had just as much to offer. Walls were fairly soundproof, i don't think it was great though. i could here people in the other room at some points, but I just think we were lucky that they weren't really loud. I would probably not recommend this hotel to friends, or i would give them the heads up like i've done here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a hotel by its exterior”
Reviews.Author: CMcBuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in late September, and I wasn't expecting much since we got a good deal on Priceline and just wanted a place to sleep. I planned to walk around all day and use the room only for sleeping and showering, especially considering the pictures I saw of the outside of the hotel. However, we arrived and were warmly greeted by the doorman, and everyone else working there was also friendly and helpful. The lobby was modern and well done, and when we got to our room, I was even more pleased. I really liked the decor, and we had a fantastic view of the CN Tower. The pillows and comforter were thick and soft, and though the room was on the small side, it was really cozy. I was so pleased that I ended up spending most of the day relaxing in the room since I've been to Toronto many times and didn't feel the need to do any sightseeing. In that regard, the only disappointment was that we didn't have a bathtub. But I was quite content to put on the bathrobe and snuggle on the bed, enjoying a day off from work. We were there only 24 hours, but I would have been quite happy to stay longer. And in the end, the ugly exterior was quite helpful. I found my way home late at night much easier than I would have otherwise! All in all, I would definitely recommend for a relaxing stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT Montreal”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasedSoul
Reviews.Content: All in all, good hotel, about 80% as good as a hyatt is expected to be. However, when we arrived, it was nuts. There was a huge protest happening outside with thousands of people celebrating their love for a hockey legend call Wendel Clark. This, to me, showed the complete isolationist view of the Hyatt management and their disconnection to Canadian culture. Aside from the foreigners (Americans and Asians primarily) who have no idea who WC is, all the Canadians staying there were appalled. How could a hotel condone a player from the Toronto Maple Leafs. I went to the concierge to express my disgust (we could nearly hear them chanting his name through the window), and he just said, "Yes, we know. You are the 50th person to have complained. I am also from Montreal and to me, this is agony." He offered us ear plugs and a discount for the Hockey Hall of Fame which we both agreed should be in Montreal - but them I reminded him the Hall was actually in an old Bank of Montreal building so he felt better. Without this concierge's profound appreciaiton of the near suffering, I would not have been able to have spent another minute in the hotel---- which, aside from this experience, was a perfect escape from the ruthless and useless climate of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE ROOM, HOTEL, AND LOCATION, the staff... ehhh”
Reviews.Author: azngurl54
Reviews.Content: the room was amazing, with everything you need, the bathroom was elegant, but the door was a little hard to open, the view was beautiful, and the bed was SOOO comfortable!!! The front desk staff were a little uncooperative, but the activity desk person was nice and infomative

Reviews.Title: “Look for another option”
Reviews.Author: klkh2002
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Toronto was the second leg of a long overseas trip and it had the misfortune of being the next hotel I stayed in after the Grand Hyatt in Hong Kong. That said, I have stayed in many four star hotels with excellent and attentive staff. That cannot be said for the Hyatt in Toronto. The check -in proved to be tedious and they had not picked up an amendment to my booking which my secretary had confirmed by e-mail (which she had received an acknowledgement to from the hotel). The staff member I had fluffed around for ages booking me in. That was exasperating enough but what really did it for me was I was stupid enough to walk out of my room an hour later without my room key. I went down to the staff member who checked me in who orf course recognised me but she made me walk through broken glass to get back in my room, She was simply completely inflexible and I ended up waiting fifteen minutes in reception for a member of security to take me to my room to "identify" me. That in itself already confirmed for me I would never stay in the hotel again but it didn't improve from there. I found one of the housekeeping staff on my floor quite rude particularly when she wanted to service my room notwithstanding we had arranged a late check-out. The hotel looks ok from the outside but is very tired on the inside now. On the plus side, the gymnasium/fitness centre is small but excellent. I also like the percolated coffee machines in each room. I can't imagine I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: MartinK72
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. I thought that I would be safe by choosing a Hyatt Hotel, but unfortunately it was a bad choice. Reception staff were rude and unaccommodating, rooms were dirty and the Concierge was only suggesting tours where he is making comission instead of giving independent advice.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator and Cleanliness Issues but Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Canuckontour
Reviews.Content: I am a Hyatt Platinum member and have stayed here over 15 nights year to date for two extended business and both stays have been consistent. Firstly, I am not entirely sure what this "Regency" brand is trying to project to its customers. Is it a mid range hotel? Are they trying to be just a step down from the Park Hyatt's? To me it seems like an equivalent to a newer Holiday Inn or Hilton Garden Inn. There definitely seems to be a disconnect from planned to actual (on the value proposition). First the good: the location is excellent. King Street West is full of great places to eat, shop and for me close to work. You also have a pharmacy just across the street which is convenient. The fitness centre is well equipped and the roof top area is nice offering an amazing view of the area. There are lots of lounge chairs to relax in. Also a nice place to go for a swim. The beds were very comfortable, and the flatscreen TV was new and probably the largest I have seen in a hotel room! The staff are for the most part friendly and service oriented. Now the areas for improvement. This is my biggest issue with this hotel: during both my stays which were weeks apart, 2 of the 4 elevators were not working. This often created a long wait in the morning and was very annoying. When the elevator did arrive you are packed in there with too many other guests. Not ideal for anyone claustrophobic! While the room looked somewhat renovated the cheap furniture does not appear new. The white leather club chair was so soiled you would not want to sit in it! Note to the designer, gray, black or brown chairs are better for commercial applications. The bathroom vanity is very small and the vessel type sink is not at all practical. The red lacquer look gives the room an eighties feel. I did not find the bathroom clean at all. Where the wall meets the bottom of the bathtub there was a lot of grime and hair built up which is not up to a 4 star hotel cleanliness standard. The ceiling has a few spots of what looked like water damage that needed repair. The food and beverage is extremely overpriced. $14 for a glass of mediocre Italian red wine at the bar is pushing it! Some mornings I was awoken to construction above me and the sound of a hammer and drill. I think 7 am is much too early for this type of annoyance.There were noticeable staffing issues including 10 people queuing to check in to one frazzled agent who was also dealing the best he could to phone lines ringing. I did not like having to buy an Internet card for minutes in the business centre so passed on that added expense. Free internet is the norm at hotels and motels in Canada nowadays. This hotel is at best a 3.5 star. Recommendations to management: get your elevator maintenance repairs complete pronto, pay more attention to your cleanliness standards and offer free internet. I just returned from the Vancouver Hyatt Regency and feel that property is a much better property overall.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Diamond Member Reports: Bed Bugs or something in the pullaway! Also, Its party hotel.”
Reviews.Author: smashadmns
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I read Trip Advisor all the time but this stay made me sign-up. I feel bad about writing this because our house keepers and the front desk agent, Sam are very nice, helpful and well meaning. I stay in a Hyatt Regency 95% of the year, so I am pretty accustomed to the Hyatt properties in my travels but this is the first time I've experienced bed bugs and I find it gross and FREAKING ITCHY. I attending a wedding last night and spend most of it itching myself. ugh. annoying. Upon reporting the bugs, the front desk Manager, Kristine was very professional and offered to run and get itch cream and even another room. I appreciate that and she was very well meaning but apparently according to Hyatt policy they have to send exterminators in first to do anything in terms of resolving customer satisfaction. (comp night, discount, etc.) but I guess the bottom line is, even if it was a free night stay, it doesn't change my memory of the stay, which is leading me to write this review. Overall the hotel is meh, nothing special and upon doing some research I found that this property was actually a holiday inn or something budget before becoming a Hyatt, which leads me to my next point. Of the Hyatt properties I've stayed at I would find this one on the bottom tier. Hotel Vibe. It's a party hotel, full of party patrons. I get it. I am in my 20s, I do that too. but they should at least make this hotel an Andaz property then and not try to hide that its something else. Lobby was full of the typical party DB types, dudes not wearing shirts, drunk party girls, etc. Maybe if I was in vegas or hollywood I won't care - but we were here for a wedding and I was taking care of my parents. They weren't too happy about it. Facilities, Nothing special, Gym is your typical Hyatt Stay Fit gym. Pool seems like it has a cool view and they have a sauna. Parking is super expensive but that's typical of a downtown hotel. I wish they posted it... hate how those fees always seem to spring up on ya. Food Room service is good. room service food is bad. I came in late on Thursday night and got a pretty cold sandwich with cold fries. There is no regency club so they offer breakfast buffet. reminded me of Hampton in quality food. runny eggs, plain sausages. Back to bed bugs. So - the hotel management response has been on par so far. they've photographed my bug bites, offering to inspect the room, rand and consulted a pharisist to buy hydrocortizone and even offered to adjust the room. Again... all very well meaning and Kristene the front desk manager is doing a good job at trying to help resolve it... but still doesnt change the fact that I got all these bites. I am just a very experienced Hyatt customer who is very disappointed on my stay. The staff and manager mean well... but the i am left with an Itchy feeling. Just feeling a gap on justice. Hyatt's I'd recommend Bellevue Shanghai Hangzhou Hong Kong Los Angeles - Century City Huntington Beach San Francisco - Financial District Andaz San Diego Andaz Hollywood. Hyatt's I'd not recommend. Hyatt on King Toronto

Reviews.Title: “First class room and customer service!”
Reviews.Author: thutchens
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive after seeing the comments about the elevators and cleanliness of the rooms, but I've got to tell you...after staying there for 8 days, this place is highly recommended. If there were ever problems with the elevator speed, they must have resolved them. There are 8 of them, 4 which serve the lower 9 floors and 4 for the top 11 floors and they were fine. This was our 25th anniversary and the room we stayed in was overlooking lake Ontario, the CN tower and downtown. Below us we could see a bevy of rooftop restaurants nearby and really get a feel for siteseeing down below. The bed was a dream with it's pillowtop mattress, the large lcd TV mounted in the wall was great and we even had our own private balcony that we could walk out on. They had champaign and a cheese & crackers tray waiting in our room when we arrived with a personalized 25th anniversary card (none of which I paid for). The bath towels were large enough to be beach towels. We ate at both restaurants and the food was excellent. They have Starbucks beside the lobby that we got coffee from and I spent some time there with their free internet access. The only recommendations I would make to them to make it absolutely the best would be the make the internet access free. Many hotels include it in the rate, but many of the higher end hotels usually charge for it. The only other thing was that one day their was a labor strike and we had no maid service that day. Hotel management offered free breakfast that day with free hors d'oeuvres during a cocktail hour that evening, so it was a nice gesture. The bathroom wasn't the largest and it only had one sink, but overall, we really liked this hotel and would stay here again if we make it back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but lots of room issues”
Reviews.Author: westenda
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a lovely hotel, however the room itself needs some help. The good The hotel is close to EVERYTHING. Great location and walking distance to anything and everything The lobby is lovely Starbucks is attached reasonable rate staff were friendly but not very welcoming overall great roof top pool and fitness center The bad The room was cheaply put together (cheap furniture making it look great from a distance but not up close). There were several in room issues: bathroom door was VERY hard to open after closing it. If there was a little kid they would not have been able to open it! side table next to bed was falling off the wall cupboard door was coming off there had obviously been a leak in the room and the ceiling paint was coming off the white chair was COVERED in stains, and also had a rip on it lightbulb over bed was out a room with two double bed rooms only had two towels. I think they should put in 4 assuming the maximum occupancy None of these things were a big deal, but could have been easily repaired if housekeeping had done their job and reported these things to maintenance to fix.
