Also, they should probably not have gone for white furnature that cant be cleaned. The beds were comfortable though which was great! And most important! It was also quiet. I would recommend this hotel, if they step up their maintenance. Until then, There are many other GREAT hotels in Toronto at similar or lower rates that are maintained much better.

Reviews.Title: “The design is beautiful but it needs more elevators.”
Reviews.Author: GeekInTheD
Reviews.Content: Our room was very pretty and clean. The decor was very modern and the bathroom was gorgeous with lots of marble. Huge flat screen television as well. Our room was at one end of the ninth floor so we didn't have a lot of people walking by - we only heard the next door neighbors enter and leave. We received the extra pillows we requested, unfortunately the bed wasn't very comfortable. Could be because we have a nice soft pillow top at home (hotels can't please every type of body). The staff was nice but the lobby is a little loud for check-in. It gets busy and there are people lined up to check in, so it's difficult to hear the check-in desk worker when they're asking you questions or telling you about your room. My only big complaint about the HRT is the elevators. They have four but one was out of commission. One evening we came back after dinner and the remaining three lifts were all acting hinkey. One refused to leave the ground floor and the other two were stopping at every floor on the way up and the way down. We waited about 15 minutes to get to our room on the 9th floor. If it had been higher up it would have been a lot longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: guej
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month for a 3 night stay with my family (kids are 8 and 11). The location was great. It was a quick walk to all the major sites. The other plus was that you could buy the doubledecker tour bus tickets from the concierge and he arranged our pick up at the hotel. There is a Starbucks in the lobby for a quick coffee and breakfast in the mornings. The pleasant surprise we had was the outdoor pool on the 17th floor. After 2 days of non-stop running around, we were so happy to come back to the hotel on our last afternoon and go to the pool. We were planning to only stay an hour or so, but wound up staying for hours. The lounge chairs were so comfortable. Even though there were quite a few families at the pool, there is a 2 level outdoor deck, so there was plenty of comfortable seating. The pool isn't deep, but it was just fine to cool off and pass some time. On the weekends they have drink service. The only downside was the size of the rooms. It's like being in a New York City hotel room. There isn't much room to walk around. The bathroom was very small with virtually no counterspace. In the bedroom, there were 3 tiny draws in which you could dump some socks and underwear, and the closet had about 4 hangers in it. For a family of four, it was tough living out of our suitcase for 3 days. The staff was very nice. Parking is expensive ($25 a night), but attached to the hotel. You can park in a few spaces right outside the lobby for check-in, and then move your car to the garage. It was convenient. I would recommend the hotel for its location. Just be prepared that it's a typical city hotel with small rooms if you have a family. I got the room cheaper on Priceline, so all in all, we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Comfort for 3 Star Price!”
Reviews.Author: justcallmeryan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days for a conference trip in Toronto. Fantastic hotel, great staff and amazing location. Right on King St where all the restaurants and cafes are, and only a two block walk to the convention centre, I can't fault this venue. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greekmom99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 1 night in August as I was attending the Fan Expo in Toronto. The hotel was located 2 blocks from the Metro Convention Centre and there was a Starbucks right beside it and a Tim's further down the street. I cannot find fault with the room or the service. The reason I rated my sleep quality on the lower end is a) I always find hotel rooms a bit on the cooler side, b)there were a few Fan Expo guests talking pretty loud around 1 or 2 am for a bit and c) I just am not a comfy sleeper in another bed. Otherwise, I have to say the room was really nice, nice tv, place to hook up your cell phone and stuff to recharge, bathroom was nice and clean. I may stay there again if the price was right. Breakfast was not included with the room which was the only bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Good but ...”
Reviews.Author: dillightfulflowers
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great and we got a great deal for our money with the family package and breakfast included. But the let down for me was there was a fire alarm twice on the saturday on night so I had to wake up my six kids and walk down 18 flights of stairs without so much as an apology from the staff or a decent explanation. Other then that small drawback it is in a Great location. It was close to shopping for my girls in the Eaton centre a mere 15 minuet walk. The subway was not far either which gave us avalibilty to the more distant locations. Another bonus was the proximity to a variety of restaruant . Overall I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room/bed”
Reviews.Author: AB721
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Yankees/Blue Jays game. Hotel is only about a 6 minute walk to Rogers Centre, perfect for us. The room with a king bed gave us a partial view of the CN Tower which is lit up at night. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, the room was clean and modern, as was the bathroom. Staff were pleasant, both check in and check out were fairly quick and smooth. Yes, the elevators were slow on the morning of our departure, but the afternoon we arrived, we did not have to wait more than a minute or so. Food at the restaurant is high priced, but was good (breakfast buffet.) I do agree with the reviewer who mentioned no directions to the pool, etc. That was a little strange, considering they have a book describing services, etc. I also agree that the parking is costly-- $25 per night, but at least we were able to park there up until 4:00 on the day we checked out. Pluses: clean, comfortable, convenient location Minuses: bathroom had a frosted glass "window" which allowed a lot of light into the room-- hard for someone to be in the bathroom when someone else was sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: soulbel
Reviews.Content: After booking a room at the Regency Hyatt through hotwire and then reading some of the reviews I was a little worried about staying here but I was more than impressed with this hotel. The service was excellent, everyone was super friendly and nothing was a problem. I didn't notice the elevators being slow as commented by some people - they're just regular speed. Sure, the bathrooms are small but who spends that much time in the bathroom anyway? You're not going to throw a party in your bathroom so who needs ample space in there? I've stayed at other Hyatts and the rooms size is fairly standard. The beds were a dream - uber comfy. The pool is really nice - lots of chairs and a nice view of the CN Tower. I think they were building a bar area when I was there which would be a great place to chill out at night. The location is pretty good. Not too far from a good shopping area and lots of places to eat close by. Toronto is a big city so of course you're going to use taxis to get venture to other areas but I think that's to be expected. Taxis are super expensive here so be prepared to pay $10 for a five minute taxi ride. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money .......... in a word "Fake"”
Reviews.Author: TheDocD
Reviews.Content: Room was not very clean A/C broke down our first night there. When leaving we had to wait 1/2 hour to get down to lobby as there was only one of four elevators working. The location is decent in the Entertainment district but everything else is sub par. P.S. I parked next door @ repai r garage for $15 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views from room, service eh”
Reviews.Author: steph943
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, walking distance to several places we wanted to visit. Check in was no problem, we got a room with a balcony and great view. The room was simple and unique. On our arrival, the concierge stand was pushing a Bus and Boat Tour (which we did, but I would not recommend - the double decker bus we got on had 2 broken seats on top, though the Boat portion was very nice - I would recommend taking a boat ride in the harbor). Our room included breakfast, which was the same every day, as expected, no complaints. However, we did have a disturbing incident. After being out on the town wining and dining we rented a movie in our room and fell asleep. At approx 2:30 AM our door was opened and an employee of the hotel dropped a tube of toothpaste on the floor when my husband yelled. We didn't know what was going on. By the time we got someone on the phone at the front desk to report the incident, the person that answered the phone was the same person that had entered our room... he said that we had called down and requested toothpaste. We certainly did not call down for toothpaste as we had enough toothpaste to last us a month. Maybe it was our fault for falling asleep before securely latching the door, but it was still very unsettling that an employee of the hotel would open our door in the middle of the night. We really wanted to like everything about the hotel, but that incident was very nerve wracking! Other than the 2:30 AM intruder, we did enjoy our stay. It was quiet on our floor. We also enjoyed a few hours at the rooftop pool. Do go eat at Canoe on the 54th floor of the TD bank building, do eat at Lee, do take a boat ride in the harbor. Do stop by the Renaissance Toronto for a drink in the bar, its a great view of the Rogers Center. If you want to use the internet at any Hyatt hotel, you get free internet during your stay if you become Gold Passport Members of Hyatt, so sign up on-line if you plan on staying at a Hyatt. DO latch your door whenever you are in the room, and put your valuables in the safe!

Reviews.Title: “More show thatn quality”
Reviews.Author: girlinpei
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly looks pretty. Very modern and trendy. However, the comfort just isn't there. Everything is made to look high end but in fact seems cheap. The rooms are fairly small, there was a leak in our bathroom (leaking from the ceiling all over the floor), the phone doesn't have a button to reach the front desk, nowhere does it tell you where the pool and fitness are located, and only one elevator was working the night we stayed here. We ended up waiting anywhere from 5-20 minutes each time we needed the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - outdoor pool a plus”
Reviews.Author: GRITSinNH
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and have no complaints. We knew in advance that there would be a fee for internet access - kind of a pain, but hey, we were on vacation. Rooms were kept clean, front desk staff was friendly. Great location for exploring downtown, so after walking most of the day, an hour by the pool on the 17th floor was a welcome break. As earlier reviews have mentioned, drawer space and bathroom counter space are lacking. Also would be nice to have a mirror in the room. But these are small things. Overall - thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: udo_schuklenk
Reviews.Content: I've read the reviews of this hotel and was not just a bit worried about the place. The criticism about the elevators is very well taken, they have ... ummm ... issues. However, otherwise, this is plain a stunning hotel. The rooms are magnificent, stylish, name it. The room interior design is modern, hip, beautiful, functional compared to the drab interior offer in, say the sheraton or hilton in town. i really dig this place. the location is in the entertainment district. so, if you expect the place to be a graveyard, well, it isn't. i loved the room. i didn't stay long enough to check whether internet access incurs additional charges. if it does, that would be a good reason to stay clear of this hotel. i don't think it had a pool (at least the guest services directory didn't mention one). so if you need to swim (not unreasonable a demand in this price category), this hotel might not be for you. you can check-in comfortably from terminals at the reception, which saves plenty of time. the on-line check-out didn't work, but i could check out without hassles using the room phone. kudos to the helpful staff at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Staff Made An Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: BrendanPelto
Reviews.Content: We were moved to 3 different rooms because housekeeping wasn't cleaning any of our previous rooms upon check in. We settled on the 3rd room because we were sick of moving the luggage around under one condition: they come up and vacuum, dust, and get the hair our of the sink. They did vacuum and clean the sink but they forgot to dust. All 3 rooms had stains on the coffee table, dirt and yellow stains on the chairs and one even appeared to have dried blood. Housekeeping cleaned the room the next day and removed all toilet paper, leaving us none. In the gift shop, the worker told my petite wife to watch her portions when she was buying a bag of skittles. Saying "Tsk tsk, that is too many grams for you" We were evacuated from the hotel at 1:30 in the morning becuase of a fire alarm. We were allowed to go back in around 3:00 AM. The staff was not visible during this time and there was mass confusion. This is no longer a 4 star hotel - the service wouldn't be acceptable at a roadside motel. However, it did have a great view and the location downtown was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location.. :-)”
Reviews.Author: gaudzrn
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Hyatt. As always, I booked this room on Priceline, and got it for 70$ a night US. Most of the times that I have stayed in Toronto, and used either priceline or hotwire, I have stayed at the other great hotels closer to Young St, such as the Hilton, and the Sheraton center. This was my first time staying so far West in The downtown Core, and We loved it. The hotel itself is hard to miss due to it unique structure. Parking was very easy to find, as you simply follow the signs on the east side of the building. Be prepared to pay over 20$ a night though, but it does allow you full in and out priviliges. Check in was very quick, and the service was great. The lobby is very modern and clean. Our room was on the 7th floor, and we were very pleased with it. The rooms also follow the lobby, in which the style is very modern. There is a huge flat screen TV build into the curved walls, and the King sized bed is probably THE MOST COMFORTABLE bed we have ever slept in. The room is a 5/5 for sure in my opinion The location of this Hotel is what made us very happy, as we were only a 5 minute walk to the theatres, and directly across the street from some great unique restaurants and bistros. We also were a 10 minute walk to the Roger's centre, where we got great seats for the game off a scalper. There is also great shopping one major street up on Queen's Street, which you can follow right up to the eaton center and young street. The pool is located on the 12 th floor ( I think) and is outdoors. The view from the pool is very nice, and was a ncie break from walking around the city all day. Depending on occupancy, I could see the pool being very busy on hot summer days. For this reason, I was kinda wishing they had something like the Delta Chelsea adult only pool. We took a look into the gym, and saw that they had great modern equipment, and a beautiful view for those looking to break a sweat. What else can I say.. Great location, Great service.. Sure people will complain about the parking and such, but what do you expect, you are in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ppeter9190
Reviews.Content: Great location and a nice hotel. We stayed in a deluxe suite, and the room was good size, but the bathroom was very small, as was the bedroom. Lots of wasted space with a wet bar area. We specifically asked if the sofa bed was comfortable for our teenage son, and was told that they were just replaced and first class. It was actually just a very uncomfortable box springs. They solved the issue with a roll-away the second night. The location is great with good restaurants right across the street, and within walking distance to the CN Tower and a Blue Jays game.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel @ Toronto”
Reviews.Author: cemozBrussels
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, thinking that I found an online rate of ~120$/day. Th elocation is superb, the service is great. One night at 4am, the fire alarm started and I had the chance to see that the evacuation procedures were very smooth and the hotel had well-trained security team working very professionally at that time. I will only mention the drawbacks here, but I would recommend it to anyone. The swimming pool at 17th floor is very small (as usual) and it is a pity that there is no bar there. The rooms are not really sound-proof, and there are warnings advising guests not to make any noise after 10pm, but you can still hear the people walking through the corridor. Finally, in a civilized city like Toronto where wireless internet is free almost everywhere (even in the bus that goes to the airport), they charge a lot of money for wireless. Just go to Starbucks next door (or sit at the lower stage bar) and get connected to their wireless internet for free (hotspot_bell).

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ladycreole
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the entertainment district. It is within walking distance of some very good eateries. Take advantage of "N'awlins" on the opposite side of the street from the hotel. IT is a restuarant tha has a bar and live entertainment. It is neatly decorated with musicians of the past, mainly jazz muscians. The Royal Alexandra Theatre is a couple of blocks and the Rogers Centre is within walking distance. The St. Andrews subway stop is only about 3 blocks and this stop is only 1 car stop from Union Station. Toronto is a very walk/bike/subway friendly city. Don't waste your money on a rental car. You will pay dearly for hotel parking or on street parking, which is about a whopping $19.00 per day!! The staff are very accommadating. Concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful to e. It is a very attractive hotel inside(don't be nervous when you see the exterior). The rooms are very well appointed. I really liked the bathroom. It is small, but a shower/no tub type. The tile in the shower is beautiful. There is a zen feel to the bathroom. I loved the fact that there was an ipod docking station since I brought my ipod touch for wifii access. That brings me to another tip. There is a Starbucks virtually within the hotel and you can go there and go online. So, don't get bent out of shape about no "free wifi" in the hotel lobby. I had a great stay and would definitely like to stay here again when I return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Space Age Room, but some serious flaws...”
Reviews.Author: DiamondMinx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Toronto from July 22 to 25. I got to the hotel on the Airport Shuttle, and was dropped off on the street with no hotel sign to be seen - the driver just said "Hyatt drop off" and tossed me my suitcases. It would have been helpful if he'd said that the hotel entrance was around the corner and a half block down the street. (I realize that's an issue with the shuttle, not the hotel) There are two entrances to the hotel. One where the driveway is, which is on the same level as the lobby and has automatic doors. The bellmen are stationed here to assist with bags. ...and then the entrance closest to the Shuttle drop off and the taxi line which has two sets of doors and two small flights of steps - and nobody to help hold the doors or carry your luggage up the stairs. I lugged heavy bags (with obvious difficulty) up and down those stairs in full view of the front desk and bell desk three times over my stay and nobody offered any assistance. Whoever decided that entrance didn't require any staff assistance is nuts. There is absolutely no free wifi in the hotel. You even have to pay to use the computer in the business centre. I stay at a lot of hotels and it's been a long time since i've been in one that doesn't offer any free computing anywhere. Luckily the desk staff were kind enough to allow my partner to use one of their computers for a couple of minutes. The room itself was nice albeit small - very space age and slick and efficiently designed. I appreciated the stylishly designed drawers and cupboards as I prefer to unpack my suitcase for hotel stays. Rooms are equipped with a nice 42" flat screen. I found it odd that the sheet over the mattress was just a flat sheet pulled over the bed - it wasn't long enough to tuck underneath, and bunched up badly as we slept and moved around in bed. Not sure why a fitted sheet wasn't used. Unfortunately it appears that the housekeeping department is not very thorough as I found three pieces of broken glass on the floor, a sticker from a previous guest's purchased clothing on the wall, and chewing gum stuck to the window frame between the bathroom and the room. There were also two lightbulbs burned out in the room. I mentioned the state of the room to the front desk and was told that they would request a thorough cleaning. This did not happen. (they did comp my partner's parking on check-out as an apology, for which I am thankful, but that doesn't stop the fact that housekeeping was poor.) The staff at the front desk and bell desk were pleasant and helpful when I had questions. It was disappointing that room service in what is supposedly a 4 star hotel cuts off at 11pm. I was in TO to attend a performance festival and returned to the room around 1am absolutely famished, with only a couple of delivery options (pizza) available. The fire alarm went off at 5:15am on the Friday night of the stay. I understand that these things happen, and politely trudged down 16 flights of stairs to sit outside on the pavement for 1/2 hour while the fire department determined that it was a false alarm. ...However the volume of the alarm is kept at EARBLEED level and I ended up with a splitting headache that made further sleep difficult, and took much of the next day to get rid of. We didn't end up doing any of the things we'd planned that day. The alarm was physically painful to listen to and I had noticeable ringing in my ears afterwards. If it weren't for the fact that I got a very good deal on this hotel through Priceline, I would have been extremely upset with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: BigLasagna
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the service from Room Service and the Bell Stand. They were friendly and took the time to answer my questions and supply us with maps and tour information. The check in was very rushed and it felt like they were trying to get rid of us as the lineup was very long. We had a problem with another room that was very noisy and called the hotel operator and within seconds the security people were on our floor and dealing with the situation and making them be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view.”
Reviews.Author: AmericaM
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Hyatt in Toronto on King St. Our room was clean & comfortable and we had a really good view of the CN Tower; it was a King room w/ view. We thought the price was reasonable, especially for the location. Very modern in design. The only things we found unfortunate was the cost of parking ($25 per night), though I believe this is the case anywhere we would have chose to park in the city. The underground parking garage was unbearably hot and didn't seem very secure, though we encountered no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Needs HELP”
Reviews.Author: TravSFam
Reviews.Content: Staff was always very friendly.. Requested 2 non-smoking rooms 1 had been smoked in asked them to spray and never came. Found out later they went to wrong room.Asked fo adjoining rooms and were told we had them--NOT. Sheets did not fit the bed so they came off during the night. Did not replace lotions-shampoos for 2 of the 3 night stay. Was on a "party" floor and had a lot of noise. Rooms have been cheaply remodeled. The resteraunt did have great service with waiters and waitresses who ran their legs off since the were short handed and never lost their smiles and perfect service. Same with the bar. Breakfast day 3 they did not have potatoes so we received french fries, wiuld have been nice to have known sooner and maybe got fruit instead. When we checked out I told the young lady of all the problems and she appologized the offered us $99 rooms on our next stay there if it is before Sept.--we live in another country! The manager then took off all of our internet charges was was nice. Looks like the owners are trying to make cut backs on service.Not a 4 star--2 !/2 maybe.

Reviews.Title: “"BEWARE**MY CAR INCLUDING OTHERS Vanzalized in their underground parking”
Reviews.Author: nadia094
Reviews.Content: woke up to find that my car windown smashed into, paid additional to have my car secure and park underground! not just my car byt multiple cars were broken into that night! so much for secure!!! and to top it off they handled it like this wasnt the first time and advised me to contact their 3rd party! security company that doesn't have a direct line....it was a joe shmo with a cell phone. Had to dispute with the hotel manager to have my hotel stay charges revoked adter a confrontational argument! how embarassing!!! to top it off noone from the hotel or franchise has contacted me to do a followup about the situation! I had to drive home with glass all over in the backseat because their vacum was so called "backed up" due to cleaning other peoples damaged viechles! Do not recomment this hotel to anyone! Very overpriced, Very dramatic, much nicer hotels in the area that are customer service based and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and convenient but elevators need a lot of improvement.”
Reviews.Author: justmyinput
Reviews.Content: We went there to attend 3 days of baseball. It was exremely convenient to the stadium. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in and I have had extensive domestic and overseas travel. The staff was very acommodating, the facilties were clean and modern except for the elevators. On that note, I read some reviews of about a year ago and the elevators was a source of complaints at that point and it was said they were being repaired. A year later, the receptionist told me they were under repair so it would suggest it is a problem they cannot resolve. On at least two different occasions, we were in a line of 10-12 people wating for an elevator and on 2 other occasions we had to wait for 5 or more minutes for an elevator to reach our floor. It was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic location in a fantastic City!”
Reviews.Author: whiteorchidLaurie
Reviews.Content: I am having my wedding in Toronto and my out-of-town guests are staying at The Hyatt on King Street. I live in NYC and went there this weekend to check it out and was blown away! The website pictures DO NOT do it any justice. The hotel rooms are clean and modern with a supreme view of Toronto. The outdoor deck and view is breath taking. The outdoor lounge area is great with a clear view of the CN Tower. If you have never been to Toronto, the location is center-city. Just outside the hotel is entertainment, food, theatre and just a short walk to the waterfront. I was raised in Toronto and highly recommend choosing the Hyatt for your stay. You will not be disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, trendy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: danicaaa
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hyatt to stay in for my company's holiday party. I booked through Priceline and got an awesome deal for a two-king bed room. Although a little squished, the room was beautiful with lots of earth tones. It came with a flat screen and a glass-walled bathroom. Parking was expensive, at an extra $25 a vehicle. But, I would definitely book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really more a limited service hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: NYCan
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Hyatt due to the current Welcome Back promotion. It was my first stay at the hotel and I would say it was dissapointing. I believe the hotel was a conversion and it feels like it was done a little on the cheap. I misplaced a bag with some clothes and called back after checkout. I was told that I had to leave a voicemail with building security and the recorded message said that I could expect a response in 48 to 72 hours. For a full service hotel this in unacceptable. As a Hyatt Platinum I would have hoped someone could have made a simple call to figure out if the bag was in the building or not. On the positive side the rooms look fresh although again some of the items look more fitting of the building's select service past.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you need a decent night's rest”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa00
Reviews.Content: If you like to get a good night's rest, avoid this place. For two reasons: the construction of the hotel and the clientele. This hotel seems to cater to a lot of noisy groups (i.e. teenage sports teams) and other younger partiers in their 20s. We switched rooms and floors after the first sleepless night only to have the same constant drunken yelling and hooting and hollering and running around in the hallway the second night. The hotel claims to have a strict 10pm quiet policy, but it's up to you to enforce it. Coupled with this, the rooms let all kinds of noise in. Even when people are talking with ordinary volume in the hall, you can hear everything in your room. The doors close incredibly loudly. We stayed 3 nights and the noisiest were the Friday and Saturday - only on Sunday (maybe when people were on their way home) did we get a decent uninterrupted nights' rest. The staff were pleasant and friendly and very accommodating. However, I won't be staying here again. The first time in my life, I actually dreaded coming back in the evening to this hotel! We weren't early to bed either, came in around 11pm on average all weekend.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: 506canuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend and had an excellent time. We went to see Mamma Mia and Rock of Ages and this hotel could not be more convenient. There are also a lot of great restaurants and shopping nearby. We also got an extremely good rate by using Priceline but check-in did not go too smoothly. Although I had called ahead and requested two beds I was unlucky to get the clerk who had no interest in helping me with that. On top of that she wanted to charge me $25 for a cot. The previously unavailable room materialized with two beds in the end when my wife pointed out to her that the customers to the left and right of us (including someone who also had a Priceline reservation) had made the same request and got the two beds. The elevator situation is ridciulous with two of the four elevators under renovation and my other complaint would be the noise other guests make at 4am when they returns from the nightclubs, yelling to each other is unnecessary. I got the impression that a lot of people on Saturdays book a room there so they don't need to take a cab home. The hotel is very up to date and the rooms comfortable although drawer space iks limited if you are ther for more than few days.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and great location”
Reviews.Author: welove2travel123
Reviews.Content: We just stayed the weekend at the Hyatt Regency. the hotel was modern, clean, and the location was great. Located in the entertainment district, lots of great restaurants, walking distance to everything. The bed was very comfy. The only complaint i had was that the cleaning staff only left decaffeinated coffee for the machine in the room and only one package of creamer/sugar. Also, the elevators were out of service at times. This wasn't a huge deal though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, but dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: The-chipsta
Reviews.Content: Perfect downtown location with stylish rooms and nice views, but between the fact that only one or two of the four elevators ever work and the pool is never open it is a bit dissapointing. The staff is very friendly, but the food and drink prices are quite high. Oh and did I mention parking is $25 per day...ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Toronto Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mommyofacutie
Reviews.Content: Every May, we rent a hotel in Toronto for an annual event that my husband and I attend. We have stayed at several downtown TO hotels and this was by far the best experience we have had. We have stayed in some very small rooms and some very dirty rooms, this was neither. We booked through Priceline and got a fantastic rate (more than 50% off the rate on the Hyatt website). We did the bid system so we didn't know what hotel we were getting until after we paid and I was a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews but all I can say is that some people may be a bit too picky or have no experience staying in Toronto because we found this hotel fabulous! When we checked in, we found out we were booked for a double room - I nicely asked if they had any King rooms available and without hesitation we were upgraded for free. We were given a room on the 11th floor, looking directly at the CN Tower. We had one of the rooms with the rounded windows (you can see them next to the Hyatt sign if you look at a picture of the hotel). That was a nice touch as well since I have seen the pictures of the rooms with the flat walls and they look smaller (which is still a good size for a Toronto hotel). We loved the decor - completely our style. Maybe modern-chic is not for everyone but I'd have to say that it was very clean and in the end that's what matters most. The staff was fantastic. We only had 1 pack of caffinated coffee in the room so I called the front desk and within 10 minutes someone had brought us more. The beds were extremely comfortable - plush pillow-top mattress. It was actually a King mattress, not two doubles pushed together which is definitely a nice change from what some other TO hotels offer. We had 5 pillows in the room which to me is plenty - not sure why anyone would need more than 5. I also noticed the gap others had mentioned between the mattress and the headboard. It's not an open gap, it's solid, we propped our pillows on it and sat up fine to watch tv. We didn't even notice it when we slept. We put out the room service card for breakfast and it was promptly delivered at the time we requested. Compared to room service rates at other hotels and the quality of food, it was a fantastic breakfast. Checkout was very quick and hassle free. When my husband got the car from the parking garage, there was a ticket on it and the hotel apologized immediately and voided the ticket. Not something I'm going to get angry at since it's another company who administers the tickets and they obviously weren't using an updated list of hotel guests. A couple other guests got them as well but no one seemed upset about it since the hotel handled it very professionally and quickly, without question. We will absolutely stay there again and would even be willing to pay full price to ensure we get the same hotel. Oh and I just wanted to add, we were never asked to sign any sort of form about the 10pm noise policy. We are in our late 20's, maybe they only make younger people sign them? ... and we didn't use the internet - had too many plans that night, the laptop never even came out of the bag.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SConthemove
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff is top notch. Room was very clean. Issue with the elevators is a MINOR inconvenience. Try Kit Kat for italian food (on King Street, easy walk) - great ambience and excellent food at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller66
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights. There were repairs going on to the hotel elevator but the rooms had great views, were clean and modern, and the staff were there to serve you.

Reviews.Title: “Top class room with good view”
Reviews.Author: sars82
Reviews.Content: This is centrally located and is just 5 minutes away from the CN Tower.I took the daily rates option and got a room on the 18th floor with a majestic view of Toronto. The room was good. The daily rate option doesn't give Internet service for free. It is charged at $15 per hour. The Gym is spacious and has all modern equipments. The pool was closed as it was Winter time. The room service was good. There are lots of restaurants just outside the hotel, so you are not forced to eat the costly Hotel food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Not a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelpee
Reviews.Content: Our room was hot or cold, never comfortable. Views were great, windows were filthy. Wi-Fi was $14.95 which I was charged twice because I was stupid enough to check my email before checking out. Parking was $25/day. There was NO bathtub, just a shower. 10PM curfew No table in the room, just a small desk. Several lights would not work in the room. It's an ok hotel that I won't be booking at again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt rather like a (successful) cross between a boutique hotel and a sought-after urban apartment or condo building.”
Reviews.Author: takeonetoday
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my daughter at this Hyatt Regency for two nights during March Break . It was recommended to me and we were not disappointed. We would love to return during the warmer months as the rooftop patio/pool would be fun. To me at least it has a unique, sophisticated feel of a boutique hotel and urban residential building hybrid which we found very welcoming. I could not disagree more about some of the negative tripadvisor comments about the look and atmosphere, and never had a single elevator issue. There is a small sign indicating work to improve elevator service will be completed soon; the hotel is hiding nothing that way. We were on the 15th floor with a spectacular view of the CN Tower, which for those that don't know, is quite a light show at night! OK, our room (two double beds) wasn't huge, but more than adequate for two, and we really liked the simple decor. Lots of dark wood, cool, well-designed white lacquered storage units with pomegranate coloured accents, and a compact but very nice marble and granite bathroom, with a (privacy) glass door and wall window which let in natural light, something I have never seen in a hotel room. The room itself and bathroom were spotless and the toiletries good quality and plentiful. The beds (with feather pillows and a great duvets) were super comfortable; combined with the very quiet atmosphere, this hotel certainly offers a good night's sleep. We enjoyed the big flat screen TV and iPod dock also. The location is good, a short walk from the train station in good weather (likely easy also from the underground (Path?) system regardless). If you looking for nightlife, you're in the right district as it literally is in the Entertainment District. Second City Comedy Club is steps away--check out their Monday night deals. We were there to shop, so didn't go there this time, maybe next. Of course this Hyatt is also right near live theatre and many restaurants, pubs and bars. I was told by the (unobtrusive, yet friendly and helpful!) desk staff that the Toronto Film Festival will soon be hosted from their new venue, also very nearby, by 2011. This Hyatt will fill up at that time to be sure--likely a great spot for celebrity spotting IF you can get a room that week! I was warned to book far ahead. It's a close walk to Queen Street shopping and other shopping, museums, and other activities are a close drive, streetcar, subway or taxi away. We didn't dine at either restaurant, so can't comment on those, they looked very chic however, and I saw several comfortable looking patrons drinking wine at the brand new--it opened the day we arrived--ground level bar (actually a bit above ground, the restaurant "downstairs" is actually steet level with what would likely be good people watching.) I should mention here that the lobby and the two restaurants were all very well-designed and appointed in our opinions, with a retro but trendy feel. There is a water feature in the lobby flanked by amazing huge sofas, great for hanging out while you decide what to do for the day--much too much choice in Toronto if there is such a thing--NOTE: do not miss the Distillery District, worth the visit. There is a multi-level Starbucks right off of the lobby and a Cora's a few blocks away, both great for breakfasts. No. 99 (Wayne Gretzky's restaurant) is also just around the corner for hockey fans. I would recommend this hotel to anyone except those who feel they need the use of a pool during a winter stay. We saw people of all ages, business and leisure travellers alike staying at this Hyatt. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, plenty of rest nearby”
Reviews.Author: rzx42
Reviews.Content: So hard to pick a hotel but since I was a hyatt club member decided to stay there. room was very clean and tidy, contrary to al the comments re the lifts they were fine, hotel bar and rest. was pretty good as were the local rest. just down the street only minutes away. Highly recommended for business travelers...

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: fullermel
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my husband who was on business and my two children. The room was a little cramped, which is to be expected in downtown Toronto. Modern decor, clean, very friendly staff and location is great if you are looking to stay in the Theatre District. The only complaint I have is our coffee wasn't refreshed on our second morning. Showers were fantastically hot and lots of pressure, wasn't expecting that, so bonus there.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the high rates and stay some where else.”
Reviews.Author: Advidtravellor
Reviews.Content: Hotel was too far out of the downtown core to walk anywhere. No valet parking or bell boy. No pool or hot tub as its closed for the winter although not stated on the website Staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. Has a no noise policy after 10 although was kep tup until 3am with partiers from another room- no obviously no enforced. There are 20 floors and only 2 out of the 4 elevators worked, so expect a 10 minute wait to go to the lobby .... Save your money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Salz00
Reviews.Content: We had to attend a convention in downtown Toronto..and Holiday Inn Express was the closest hotel we could find accomodation for 2 for abt $200 per night. The reception area is quite outdated and needs urgent refurnishing..but beyond the lobby, the hotel is quite pleasant. Rooms are nice and spacious for two and very nice, clean bathrooms with a glass panel. The beds are the most comfortable to sleep in and have a wide range of cushions. Travellers even have the option of choosing their own pillows after a detailed session with the pillow experts! Basic ammenities such as tea, coffee maker available. Nice LCD TV on the wall with a radio alarm. We had a good view of the CN tower from our window. A little steep for 200$ a night, but its downtown Toronto,so cant complain! The breakfast buffet can get expensive as its not included with the room tariff, so after the frist day, we preferred catching breakfast outside at Tim hortons and other places which are all at a walking distance. Even the CN tower and the Toronto Convention Center is at a walking distance. We took the shuttle bus from the Airport which drops you right outside the Hotel and pick up is the same way. Overall a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Service was fantastic and all employees were friendly”
Reviews.Author: wiky_6hills
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying in Downtown Toronto over a hundred times in the last few years. I like to travel comfortably and do not change into business wear after arriving. The employees will look you over not realizing you are responsible for most travel arrangements for your office. They accommodated our group and requests instantly, no excuses!!!! Awesome Service

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated Hyatt is always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: BluDragonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Former Holiday Inn is now a new Hyatt on King Street. Three nights. Pros: New everything and very nicely done Starbucks in lobby Super comfortable beds and linen Large Flatscreen TV Quiet Room Good casual resturant/bar at basement level Very helpful Bellmen--shipping a package & getting transportation Very helpful conference staff and food prepared for conference attendees was very good Downtown location (near financial district) without downtown price Cons: Tiny bathroom--no counter space for toileties VERY, VERY slow elevators (2 of 4 being replaced)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hyatt we stayed in”
Reviews.Author: meljup
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a few Hyatts and lots of hotels in North America, and this one was one of the best. It is cheaper and better appointed than the Grand Hyatt we stayed in in another city. Newly refurbished rooms, with huge tv's, good cable and lovely views of the city. The service was impeccable, and welcome after a whole days traveling from LA via NYC. I wished I'd stayed longer than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angela_The_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with great rooms and in room entertainment. The rooms aren't the largest int he city but they are very comfortable with a wide range of HiFi inputs etc to make your stay just like the home/office. The location is very central as well making it an overall fantastic spot to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite there yet”
Reviews.Author: actisup
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt (I believe it was formerly an IBIS) has a good location and is a modern build, but it has some of the slowest lifts in the civilized world. The rooms were comfortable but the bathrooms small. Desk staff were not very knowledgeable or helpful. $14.95 for access to a slow broadband service is appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Looked great, but not a good place to party”
Reviews.Author: wouldtravelforever
Reviews.Content: I got an amazing deal through Travelzoo an decided to have some friends over before we headed out for the night. What i didn't know until i booked and paid for everything is that they have a 10pm silent zone. We couldn't even talk to eachother without concern that we would get kicked out. Yes, it is a lovely hotel, but if you plan on having fun, especially after 10pm, don't even think about going here. As well, when I was looking for a parking spot underneath the hotel, I found several cars had their driver side windows broken. I was concerned and told the conceirge, I talked to security, and they seemed to not even care. So i was very disappointed with that. Overall a beautiful place, very mordern and sleek, but not a place to be if you want to have a good time with friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Three Dressed Up As a Nine”
Reviews.Author: Aldo48
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is in a great location - near entertainment and short taxi/subway ride to shopping. Airport Bus stops at the hotel too. Plus Side: Great service by very helpful and attentive staff. But I rate the service much lower becuase the "hotel" doesn't provide services you'd expect from a Hyatt Regency. Downside Service Examples: Bar closes at 10pm - so does the restaurant. No room service either after that - I mean not even a cold sandwich - nothing. Great news if you arrive hungry from the airport late in the evening. Is this really a Hyatt Regency? I also feel a hotel like this should provide free internet service these days. It was 26 dollars or something..but I was able to freeload on other available signals in a fairly dense population area. I filled out their auto-request to me for opinions. Received no reply on my gripes..unlike Marriott which has always been fast to reply - personally - from general managers. I felt my opinions were probably just ignored at Hyatt. The price paid was good - but I booked long in advance. Would I stay here again? Probably not - in fact probably won't stay at any Hyatt again (had a bad experience with the one in Hua Hin, Thailand too..they said kids stay free, but then insisted I get an extra room for my 4 and 6 year old!).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Oceanangel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt on King during the Labour Day weekend. We got a great deal on Travelzoo Canada and upgraded to the Upper King view. Our room was spacious, clean and the view was to die for, overlooking the Lake and CN Tower. The concierge were helpful and provided us with some good advice. The front reception staff were okay and upon departure we noticed a slight negative attitude with the lady closing our account. It was ever so slight, but uncalled for. We enjoyed the room's decor and outdoor swimming pool which we enjoyed due to the lovely warm weather. Our bed was comfortable, spacious and the outside view was wonderful. We did not purchase any extras or park our rental car (we arranged our rental car for the day we checked out of the Hyatt). Our stay in Toronto was delightful and a perfect start to our trip of southern Ontario (NOTL and Niagara Falls).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JPD74
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and well located hotel. With the airport express bus dropping you off at the door so had no problem getting to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: WallyGreenblatt
Reviews.Content: hotel offers exactly what you can expect, everything ok and clean. There is nothing special I can say, just stayed here one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: caroljf24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt because of great price and location to baseball stadium. The check-in process was easy and friendly. The concierge was very helpful in helping us arrange transportation and also ideas of good restaurants. We had 2 rooms, one was very quiet and one had a noisy party near by. The staff was very helpful in locating another room. The motel has recently been redecorated and looks good. The location was close to the subway and bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: stillsmoking
Reviews.Content: Went on Hotwire and book a 4 star hotel on the West end of downtown Toronto. Was let down when I seen that trip advisor and AAA both rate the hotel as only a 3 star hotel and even complain to Hotwire about rating in a 4 star hotel. (which did little good, lol) Is it a 4 star hotel, maybe not but its a strong 3.5 star hotel. I got a room with two queen beds and found both beds very nice. All rooms have a very large flat screen TV, my friends were staying at the Hilton and their flat screen TV at either 32 or 36 inches look so tiny compare to mine. The room had rocker switches for the lights and were very easy to find in a dark room, wel placed and thought out. Right at the edge of the bed is a rocker light switch for the overhead bed light and they were not bright at all. The bathroom had a frosted glass window which allowed the main room light in or the bathroom light out if the main room was dark. I loved how I could easily make the room as dim or bright as I liked. My room was at the back of the hotel and I thought pretty quite. Sat. night at 2 am the bar music still could be hear but it is right in the entrainment strip. Was able to sleep all 4 nights just fine...I laid down at the Hilton hotel for a rest and noticed the fan louder than at the Hyatt hotel. It did help to close the bathroom door but I don't think I did each night but still slept great. My room was clean early each day and by mid afternoon the maid was gone from the floor. Nice for privacy compare to other hotels I stayed at and seen the maid all day long on the same floor. My stay wasn't perfect, the elevator was slow cause only one or two out of four was working but not longer than 5 mins I had to wait. Late at night returning to the hotel the elevator was at the lobby with the door open each time I was there...very nice. Rather wait during the day for it then at 1 am. I found the hotel staff great and very professional. Was eager and helpful yet out of the way when not needed. All in all it was one of the better hotels I been at and I stayed at over 20 so far, with 6 being in Toronto--I don't write reviews for each one.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't be my first choice to stay here again....”
Reviews.Author: frannick
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't really to my liking for a few reasons - the elevators were only working at 50% so there were long delays, made worse by the fact that the only 2 functioning elevators were separated by a split level on all floors so you had to walk up or down steps (with luggage) trying to chase a working elevator that wasn't completely full - I was on the 9th floor so to use the stairs all the time would have been a pain. Also, being a Saturday night, the hotel seemed to be full of young people who come to Toronto for the nightlife and because they can't drive home, book rooms out and were a little noisy coming and going. I must say that the room was clean but with ultra-modern decor so may not appeal to all tastes. This hotel still charges for internet and since many hotels these days provide complimentary wireless internet, the Hyatt needs to review this perhaps. Despite all the above, I found that the staff were excellent and the service was great however, would still probably look at alternate hotels before booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: chyman59
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival through the King Street entrance the first thing I see is I have pull my luggage up some six or seven steps. My first thought was who designed this? I am tired from all the traveling and now upon arriving a this over priced hotel I have to go up these steps.But the lobby was bustling and was very appealing to the eye. The cost of the room was $270 US doallars. Check in was a short wait and the room (11th floor) was clean and quiet. I noticed some water bottles on a counter in the room for $4 and though 'yeah right I am not paying $4 for a small watter bottle'. Later on in the evening I wanted to go online and it was $14.00!! No way was I going to pay $14.00 to check my e-mails. You would hope for a $270 room, the internet would be free. The hotel was in a great location. I walked later on in the evening a few blocks to go to a Torono Blue Jays baseball game. Had a great time. Many restaraunts near by and a subway station on the corner. I have to say the hotel was really nice but over priced and for them to nickle and dime you for the internet annoyed me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price for family - walk to Chinatown in 10 min”
Reviews.Author: BBHJ
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms here - each with two adults and one child (all our kids were under 8). The rooms actually varied in length (strange) so there was more room to move between the desk and the second bed if you had a longer room. We wanted to be close to Chinatown but was afraid to stay too close due to reviews of dirty hotels on TA, but this one was only about 10-15 minutes walk based on your pace. There was a 24 hour pharmacy/convenience store about a block away and a little grocery just past that. Because we had children, we wished for a mini-fridge. The pool is on the 11th or 17th floor (I don't remember) and had a GREAT view, beautiful patio furniture and a lifeguard in disguise...she was wearing plain clothes. Was a bit windy, also wished the pool stayed open longer than 5 or 6 PM. Overall, great pool with workout and locker rooms nearby. The beds, bath were clean - very fragrant "Portico" soaps and bath products were a nice bonus. We used kayak to find the best price which showed that bookin the room through easyclicktravel.com was around $89/night but with a "buy-two-nights-get-third-night-free" special. The lobby was very modern and we had to pay extra for parking, but almost every hotel in downtown charged too. Nice view from every room, and thte kids were excited to be able to pick out the hotel when looking down from the CN Tower. Almost forgot, had to pay extra for wi-fi, too (by the day) About 15 min to CN Tower, around 15 more to the Harbourfront.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: Thainy001
Reviews.Content: My Friend & I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for five nights and I must admit, we made a good choice. We managed to get a suite for a good price and the hotel is very well apointed as it recently went though a renovation. Very nice, very modern. No issues nor complaints and would certainly stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Good Trendy Hotel in Busy City”
Reviews.Author: Peens
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights in July 2009. Very clean rooms, good comfortable beds, mini fridge, coffee maker, friendly staff, etc. Lots around to see and do. Very quite at night time, in the theater district, very short walking distance if you catch a show and a 20 minute walk from the CN Tower. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaVacationgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt on a weekend trip to Toronto ... the rooms were nice, the hotel was very clean and the service was excellent. There are many attractions and great restaurants within walking distance. We got a great deal on this hotel!!! I wouldn't stay here if I had to pay the regular rates ... for 300 a night you could probably find something better

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Callaregie
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Toronto for work. This was my first stay in a Hyatt, and I was not disappointed. The rooms were modern, clean, and a good size. I understand this hotel used to be a Holiay Inn, but was bought by Hyatt and renovated. They have done a lovely job with the renovations, which have given the hotel and the rooms a very modern look and feel. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was great, and I had a great view of CN Tower. I was on the "business rate" which includes highspeed wireless and breakfast. The breakfast was in the restaurant, and I could order off the menu, which is nice. I'm not sure if there is a plan to have a more continental breakfast at some point in the future, as it appears to be set up for that. They gym was very nice - up on the 17th floor, nice treadmills and good weight equipment. It was nice to have great views of TO to look at while running, rather than being stuck in a basement. My only complaint would be about the high speed internet. If it was not included in my rate, I would have complained about it, as it was horrible. The connection was painfully slow and spotty. All in all, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Undecided”
Reviews.Author: travelbug004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for one night. Being from the Toronto area I'm quite familiar with most hotels and usually stay at the Sheraton Centre on Queen when in the city. I chose this hotel because I got a great deal on their website ($109 CND) and we were in the city for a Blue Jays game and it is only about 3 blocks from the dome. The hotel itself is very non-descript from the outside. It has no real entrance. There are two glass doors off of King St and a drive up entrance off a side street. Front desk staff were very friendly despite the fact I had requested and early check in when I booked and nothing was availble when we arrived, although two parties ahead of us were checked in. A little annoying, but not major. I was there with my husband and two kids 12 and 10 yrs. We had a double room on the 10th floor. The room is VERY small. The decor is exactly how you see in the pictures from other reviews. I understand what they were going for, but it just seemed to fall short. The room was clean and the flat screen tv (42"?) was nice. The bathroom was probably the smallest bathroom I have ever encountered travelling. It looked very cool with the bowl sink and frosted door, but there was barely room to turn around and no counter space to put toiletries. Pool and lounge area on the 17th floor is nice. Has a great view of the city and is quite large. As others have said, this hotel was full of young 20 somethings downtown to party for the night as it is located in the entertainment district. We didn't have any problems with this except for hearing them stagger in. The hotel is in a great location for restaurants, shopping,and sports events (no need to get the car out). If it were just my husband and I, and we could get a larger room ,I'd probably give the Hyatt another try. With the kids, I'll stick to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: catmad96
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised by some of the reviews - we both thought that the Hyatt was brilliant. Firstly it is located perfectly - 2 blocks from the CN tower and Rogers centre in the heart of the entertainment district. Secondly, the place is clean and the rooms are huge. Thirdly, we had excellent service. It is frustrating that you have to pay extra for parking, but this is the middle of Toronto - what else do you expect. We also got a good deal on the hotel so it didn't matter. I think people on this site often winge about the wrong things. At the end of the day we had a fantastic room at very little cost - they need to make their money somewhere so stop complaining and look no further

Reviews.Title: “good location- bad service”
Reviews.Author: e_m_m081
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a night out in Toronto. The location was great, but the concierge was rude when we called down with a question, the rooms not all that clean, and what was supposed to be a non-smoking room left all of our clothes smelling so strongly of smoke that they stunk up our rooms when we unpacked at home. They also charged us for mini-bar items that we didn't use (who would pay $4 for a water bottle when there is a drug store down the street selling them for $1?). They aren't that helpful in resolving complaints either. This hotel isn't worth it- stay at the Hilton- just as convenient and way better service/amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, but.....enough with the price gauging.”
Reviews.Author: mr.weinerdog
Reviews.Content: OK, so as stated by many others, this is the renovated, former Holiday Inn. Like many other chains, Hyatt is trying to make the rooms hip- gone are the tacky floral bed covers and carpets, in are the built in headboards and flat screen TV's. And yes, the room was pretty cool. But, the hallways are so dimly lit that they are a little seedy looking, the elevators were filthy, and although the furnishings/room were brand new, the furnishings were chipped, the sliding door to the bathroom was covered in hand prints, and the place is showing signs of lack of upkeep. I don't expect things will look so hip in another year or two at this rate. But my real issue is with the price gauging. Internet in your room? 15$ a day. Come on! Even the roadside motels chains have free interent! Parking? 25$ a day- not bad for Toronto- except the parking garage has a sign- SPECIAL 10.95! So if you pay in the garage, 10.95. If you tell the hotel yoo parked there- added to your bill- 25$. And did I mention the bottle of water in your room. A generic, 500ml bottle of warn water- with a $4.00 sticker on it (on this same trip I stayed at a Four Points by Sheraton- which had the same bottle of water in the room with a sticker that read- "It's water- of course it's free"). So Hyatt- for your price gauging alone, I will not stay there again. I don't appreciate it and will take my business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: SoccerDad_99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the newly renovated Hyatt on King recently on a visit to Toronto. We were impressed by the changes. We stayed in a standard room. The style is modern, but more importantly, very very clean. The beds are comfortable, the views to downtown and the CN tour were spectacular, and the flat screen tv was a real bonus. The one downside to the room is the size. We found it very tight for 2 adults/2 kids - especially the bathroom. Sitting room is very limited and there is little storage space for luggage. The public spaces in the hotel are also renovated. We especially loved the outdoor pool and the fitness room is the best I've seen in any hotel for a while!!! Finally, you can't beat the location of this hotel. It's within easy walking distance to the CN Tour, Rogers Centre, Princess of Wales and the Royal Alex Theatres. There are lots of restaurants along the street including a Tim Horton's less than a block away (Starbuck's in the hotel). I'd definitely stay here again, but may need a bigger room if I was to take the family.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, cozy, convenient”
Reviews.Author: wnderw
Reviews.Content: Comfy beds, nice room...not much space but I would stay here again if price was right. Concierges weren't very knowledgeable so do your homework in advance...don't rely on them for help. Our cleaning woman was super friendly and kept our room just right.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: EJCSAF
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here with some friends of mine. We were greeted by very friendly staff at the front desk. I had the Park Suite King bed and it was very spacious, bright, cozy and super clean. The hotel had great amenities and the Annona restaurant in this hotel had amazing food.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: KarenKaren
Reviews.Content: I stay downtown quite often, and like to try new places. The Hyatt had great rates so I booked 3 nights. If I hadn't prepaid I would have checked out after 1 night and gone elsewhere. The first room we were given had mold and mildew in the bathroom shower. The second room was cleaner but the shower had no water pressure-something we didn't know until we needed a shower! The carpets and elevators are filthy, and the people at the front desk, particularly the russian woman, are ice cold. The hotel is a cheap reno with no character. I'm not sure why they decided to go with a red plastic for an accent colour but the whole place looks like a tacky place trying to be hip. The elevators are not at capacity so you can expect to wait every single time. Another irritating thing is the high-tech check-in. To save yourself from standing in line, you can check in at a kiosk in the lobby. But because I needed parking, after I checked in at the kiosk I then was directed to get in line at the front desk. So my check-in was actually longer and less efficient! The only good thing about this place is the location. Thankfully there are other hotels in the area that are clean and classy.

Reviews.Title: “Baseball road trip, Great Stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: iamamsterdam
Reviews.Content: My BF and another couple recently stayed at the Hyatt and had a wonderful stay. We had a room with a view and upon checking-in we noticed that our room did not have the best of views and asked to switch rooms which they immediately did. Our next room was wonderful, great views. Hotel is located in the Entertainment District, 5 minute walk to Rogers Centre and CN Tower. Really great location. Room service was nice. And staff was VERY pleasant throughout entire stay. Little hotel gift shop was a great place to pick up late night snacks as well. Overall, we were all very pleased and had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared to spend more than you think”
Reviews.Author: Jazzmandave
Reviews.Content: Other reviews had me worried..."not hyatt quality" Well, this is an ok hotel, but if you get a rate you think is good, know that this hotel will charge you $25 per night for parking, $15 per night for slow wireless internet access, $4 for a small bottle of water, etc, etc, etc, ... Get an ethernet cable when you check in, the wireless network is snail slow, unable to load most web pages, but the ethernet cable works great. The staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby is really nice, the rooms have huge tvs but are small. The location is sketchy at first glance, the parking is unidentifiable from the front, and the hotel itself from King St. is almost impossible to find unless you are intently looking at the words on the doors. Park around back (sort of an alley/street) and go inside to register, and they will tell you about the underground parking, and I reccomend you unload before you park. There are lots of places for food in the block so no worries there. If you can get this hotel for $100 or less youve done fine.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, But Small!”
Reviews.Author: KDScottGrimsby
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency in a double room booked off of Travel Zoo. ($99/night) Check-in/out was great....received an email the day of regarding 'express check in' - and upon showing up all that was required was to use the kiosk in the lobby, swipe the credit card used to book the room with and out came the keys. Quick, simple and easy. Overall, the hotel was fine for a one or even two night stay. Great location, great view of the CN Tower, nice rooftop patio overlooking the city and a small but decent pool. Beds were rather comfortable. Room was okay - interesting modern design, but the furniture seemed to take up quite a lot of space. The room was rather tight, even with only 2 people. Cleanliness of the room definitely left something to be desired. Beer caps on the floor and around the beds, quite a bit of dust above the beds, and lack of proper cleanliness in general. I'd even go as far to say it's basically a glorified dorm-room out of 'The Jetsons.' And $15 for internet? This is something that should be included in this day and age. If you need a cheap place to crash when coming to Toronto for a show or night out, I would say its worth a look. Wouldn't pay more than what I did for the room, and have stayed at better, more comfortable places around the city for roughly the same price. I'd go back if there was nothing else available.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: NeroFlash
Reviews.Content: The hotel design is very modern and clean. The staff is very helpful. The room is comfortable with a good bed quality; the bathroom works well and has all usual items. The room view is good to the Toronto skyline. I enjoy the roof top pool and view to CN Tower. The gym is well equipped and the bathroom has a shower and a sauna. The club is walking distance shopping, nightclub, CN Tower, Roger center, Downtown, theater district and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: LWile
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently centred in downtown Toronto within walking distance of a number of different attractions. The staff were friendly and accommodating. On check-in, a set of front doors were broken and inoperable and were not fixed on the fourth day that we were there. The foyer of the other set of front doors was still bare gyproc. The room we stayed in was very modern (like it was furnished from an Ikea catalogue) however the air conditioning was insufficient. The room and bathroom were very clean and neat. The vending machines on our floor were inoperable from the point of check in to check out. All-in-all, we chose this hotel based on a friend's recommendation due to its central location-- we didn't spend too much time in the hotel. I am a fitness buff too, and I must say the fitness centre on the 17th floor is the best I have seen so far in all of the hotels I have stayed in. Check the rates on 3rd party sites and compare them to the Hyatt site-- if the third party site is less, Hyatt will beat that price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: beachbumUs
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is obviously a former Holiday Inn (from the sign at the front door) but its been nicely renovated and the rooms are quite nice. No, they're not huge, but they are nicely appointed and have nice big flat screen that you can plug your Ipod into. The bathroom is pretty cool with a nice shower. The closet is pretty small, but c'mon are you moving in? The bar is decent, but why bother with King street at your doorstep. Overall, I'd stay here again. They need to get a decent sign on the street level or a doorman, I walked past twice before I realized it was the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “4-star room & service - 3-star amenities”
Reviews.Author: goodolympian
Reviews.Content: Rooms were really good, they are different size as hotel has a strange formation but great/clean rooms. Staff and service is also great worldclass. But the amenities of the hotel is not a Hyatt 4-star. In Toronto a seasonal swimmingpool means like about 3-months of a year. In my view, thats like not having a swimming pool which is enough to drop a hotel amenity from 4 to 3. Location is good and close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOGAB53
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotel Hyatt Regency Toronto 4 nights and higly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with nice modern decor.”
Reviews.Author: tp-mich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency over Memorial Day weekend. We both loved the hotel. The lobby is really nice and modern, with a cool waterfall and really furniture. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The room was also very modern and clean. The TV in the room was huge, the bed was really comfortable, and the bathroom was nice as well. I didn't think the room or bathroom were small as others have mentioned. Also, the 17th floor features an updated fitness center, a shallow outdoor pool and deck that has a really cool view of the city. Lastly, the location of the hotel is awesome! It is right in the middle of the entertainment district and within walking distance of CN Tower, Eaton Centre, and Yonge Street. There are a ton of restaurants just across the street and Starbucks is right next door. Overall we loved the Hyatt and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not up to the Hyatt standard”
Reviews.Author: Craigeryvr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt because I got the opening special of $109 / night. I would have been disappointed if I had paid full price. This recently rennovated hotel, which has rooms that initially appear nice, quickly reveal that they were built poorly and cheaply. The rooms quickly become a distraction as you notice that the construction was rushed, sloppy, and the materials were cheap and are already starting to chip and wear. In a few years, these will look very run down. It's a shame that such a nice concept was not implemented well and doesn't meet the high standards of Hyatt. If you're not fussy about room details and can overlook deficient construction (just asthetically unattractice not structurally poor) then it's an okay hotel. Great fitness centre though and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Below Hyatt's standards and rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vl-trip
Reviews.Content: This hotel although conveniently located close to many Toronto attractions overall was below Hyatt standards. It might have been recently renovated but its interior already feels old and worn out. I wasn't impressed with the design of the room either: massive, hard to open doors, tiny bathroom, cheap wood and plastic wall panels. Our room had a view of the CN Tower but unfortunately the windows were quite dirty. Expect to pay around $15/day for the WiFi in your room, but if you need to print out something there are additional fees to use its business center.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the Discounted Price - But I wouldn't Pay Full Price”
Reviews.Author: nfp147
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby and common areas are nicely decorated, staff is friendly. The rooms are tiny, but clean and comfortable. My one complaint was that the elevators to and from the parking garage seem to be either broken, or very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough...glad I had a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Shacks29
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the new Hyatt in Toronto was pleasant. I was a little surprised about signing a noise policy while checking in. Have never seen this at any hotel. Aren't local noise bylaws enough? The location was perfect for our intentions of shopping, dining, and clubbing. The rooms are small, but the beds are very comfortable. I wouldn't want more than 2 people with luggage in a room. The 'white ginger' toiletries smelled more like toilet bowl cleaner. I would suggest bringing your own. The room was a little dusty. Enjoyed the shower very much and had excellent water pressure unlike other reviewers. The staff was friendly and helpful. Be warned the internet access will be charged to your room. NO WHERE does it tell you this or how much. We stayed for $95/night. Good value for downtown Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking to have a good time in T.O don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ddtichborne
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hyatt Regency with my boyfriend and another couple. We got two rooms and were just in town over night to go to a concert then for drinks and food. We had to sign a waiver when we checked in saying that we would not make a peep after 10:00 pm. We came home from our awesome night out and went up to our room for a night cap. We were playing music in the room as the hotel provided an IPod docking station. We made a drink and were having a great time, not overly loud for 1:30 in the morning, and staff came to our door. We answered and were immediately told to pack our bags, no warning, nothing. Even the couple with us who had their own room, were not allowed to stay and were told to leave as well. They even called the police to help escort us out, but by the time police arrived we were walking out the front doors. Obviously we were from out of town, and were not about to take a cab. The hotel staff didn't even offer to call a cab for us or suggest an alternate hotel. We were 4 adults in our 30's and 40's who were having a great night, not causing problems, or being out of control like drunken teenagers. This noise policy of theirs is ridiculous. You get a hotel to have somewhere to stay for a night after having drinks and long day/night out in town, and you talk to loud or listen to music provided by them and you are kicked out. This policy is going to hurt their business eventually, when someone leaves their property after being intoxicated and has no where to go and gets hurt or drives when they shouldn't. This will lead to a huge lawsuit for the Hyatt Regency if they don't adjust their noise policy. I would never suggest this hotel to anyone who wants to have a good time in Toronto, or to anyone who thinks they will have a safe place to go to after a night out. Thanks for reading.
