Reviews.Title: “Met the standards of the Hyatt brand”
Reviews.Author: daninny
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Toronto for 4 nights during our kids' spring break and got the Grand Opening special rate for $119 CDN/weeknight and $109 CDN/weekend. The hotel has been completely renovated to the standards of the Hyatt brand. The renovation was done to a contemporary style with sleek lines a dark brown/white theme. There is a flat screen tv in each room, modern bathroom, and very modern looking floor plan. The front desk staff was especially friendly and helpful and answered all questions enthusiastically and with a smile. This was certainly very well worth the cost of the stay. Parking was also available for $18 CDN/night - a very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed ... big time”
Reviews.Author: errant
Reviews.Content: I should've known I'd have issues with this hotel when it took me four tries to get my reservations right via the Hyatt booking number. Four times -- I was patient but I really wanted to tear my hair out. It still wasn't right when I got to the hotel. Did I get the room I had requested? No. And they weren't even busy. The young woman at the front desk was snippy. Big time. Wrong job for her. She thrust a form in front of us to sign. What was it? It said the Hyatt had the right to throw us out if we were noisy, had a party in the room or anybody complained. Huh? We're two 46-year-old adults with our teenaged son. Hardly the party crowd. Still, we had to sign. Corporate policy because, as she severely told us, the hotel was a big draw for people coming in from the suburbs to "party" in the entertainment district on King Street and its environs and they've had lots of problems in the past with rowdy drunks and noise. Oh goodie. The room was meh. The hotel has been newly decorated, yeah, but by somebody who has been asleep for the past 10 years or so. The rooms already look dated. Give 'em a few more months with the "partiers" and they'll look really tired. And, by the way, if they don't want people partying in the rooms, why do they supply iPod docks? Maybe they do the same thing as they've done to the TVs -- modulate the volume so you can hardly hear the movie -- we had to sit on the end of the bed to listen to a movie -- and no, we're not hard of hearing. The beds were quite comfortable, thus the two stars I've reluctantly bestowed upon this hotel. However, they kept slipping off the mattress. I find it offputting to see bare mattress in hotels. Too high up on the ick factor for me. The bathroom? Shower pressure wasn't great. Both the sink and the tub were slow to drain. Nothing like standing in dirty water when you're taking a shower. Ugh. And the toiletries were stinky. Why do some hotels think you want to smell like white ginger/lotus/grapefruit/grandma's perfume? Oh, and while I'm at it, I resent being told to call down to housekeeping (as instructed on a little card) if I want to change my towels or sheets -- not automatically done. No turn down service. No in-room safe. Didn't check out the mini-bar. And, snarky young woman at the front desk -- Milestones is not an acceptable answer when I ask you for a good, local place to eat. It's a chain just slightly above Applebees. The Hyatt Regency Toronto is offering a good rate right now. Would I go back? No. Would I recommend it? No. Would I pay higher for a hotel so I wouldn't have to stay there again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Sleek Look--Great Service, Amazing Deal”
Reviews.Author: lawgirlMI
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. We got there early in the day and were able to check in early, no wait at the desk. Got to our room, and we had been upgraded to a city view room. For less than $100 per night (American). Our room was very modern, awesome flat screen TV, very sleek bathroom. Checked out the fitness room which had very nice stuff, and the pool on the roof was awesome (if it were warm out, LOL). Checkout was easy as well. Overall, this place was awesome. I would highly recommend it to anyone, especially now with the prices this low! Loved how close it was to the Rogers Centre.

Reviews.Title: “First night chaos probably not representative!”
Reviews.Author: hoboesque
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the first night of the hotel's opening. Hyatt have just taken over the franchise from another chain, so taxis and local residents (be warned!) won't know it as a Hyatt. They'll know it as "that ugly hotel on King St"! It's not that ugly, just a bit out of place - but you'll recognise it easily as you walk home. Let me try to assume it wasn't the first night. The room was too small for the bed - Hyatt's introducing their mega-beds into all their hotels, which is fine, but the room wasn't designed for it. So there was a bed big enough for three families to live in, but less than 1 foot (20cm) clearance from the foot of the bed to the closet, and if you opened the door to the room you blocked that space! Very silly. On the bright side, the staff are clearly pumped to be working for Hyatt rather than their previous chain, so service was enthusiastic. And the room facilities were fine, tea/coffee maker, good bathroom, etc. Otherwise the hotel's probably ok. On the first night, however.... The internet didn't work properly, and the IT support was clearly clutching at straws in trying to fix it. I gave up, and hijacked a connection at my various business meetings. There was no restaurant "just order room service for breakfast". On the second day I did, and it didn't turn up, despite a reminder. On the first day (having checked in late the previous evening) I had to postpone my breakfast business meeting hurriedly! The lobby was a dust bowl as the contractors were still doing their stuff. The housekeeping staff still hadn't finished the room by 5pm despite me being out all day (and were negotiating with each vocally down the corridors to locate soap, towels, coffee, etc!). Generally it was glorious chaos. I'm sure that'll fix, and, as I say, the staff were clearly motivated. But I've made a mental note to myself never to be a hotel guinea pig again. It made for some entertaining stories to tell, but added some unneeded inconvenience to my business schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Love Pets?? Forget This Place!”
Reviews.Author: snasp
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent visitor to Toronto and have been welcomed with my pet dog at nearby downtown hotels and many times at this property under its former brand. I was excited about the rebranding to Hyatt because of their reputation but was disappointed merely seconds after walking through the doors of this property. A warning to other pet owners and lovers that pets are not so much as allowed to walk through the lobby of this hotel let alone be welcomed as guests. Hopefully bi-pedal customers are better treated under this new management!

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency Toronto
HotelInfo.Address: 370 King Street West, Toronto, Ontario M5V 1J9, Canada
